story:
We, Hilary and Stephen Scharper, are professors at the University of Toronto who both love and value trees. In June 2012, our neighbor decided she wanted to get rid of a beautiful and healthy Maple tree whose trunk is growing across both our properties. Without informing us, our neighbor unilaterally obtained a permit to destroy the tree.

We hired certified arborists who established that the Maple was healthy and should not be destroyed. We offered to pay entirely for maintaining the tree, but our neighbor refused. Instead she sued us, claiming full ownership of the tree with the intention to fell it. We hired celebrated enviromental and civl rights lawyer Clayton Ruby to defend us and won our case at Ontario Superior Court. 

This is a landmark case for tree preservation. 

Until this ruling, the typical practice was for one neighbor to unilaterally cut down a shared tree and deal with the "fall-out" later.  

This ruling puts a stop to such practices. It puts legal "teeth" into the protection of our urban forest and beloved backyard trees.

It is the first time that the Ontario Forestry Act has been applied in an urban context. As reported on the front page of the June 19th Globe and Mail, this ruling can potentially save thousands of trees from arbitrary destruction. Thanks to this case, it is now a criminal act if one neighbor injures or cuts down a shared tree without the co-consent of their neighbor. Failure to do so can result in a $20,000 fine or jail time.

Our neighbor, however, is preparing to appeal this decision. The appeal process could lead to the reversal of this landmark ruling.

Thus far, we have spent thousands of dollars of our own money in legal fees, and now need to raise $40,000 to respond to the appeal and defend this ruling.

We ask you to help us by making a donation (no amount is too small!) and/or sharing this campaign with your networks.

Thank you!

For the Globe and Mail article, please see:

http://www.theglobeandmail.com/news/national/one-tree-two-neighbours-and-a-changed-legal-landscape/article12698935/

story:
Cairo (the capital of Egypt) is one of the most polluted cities in the world According to the World Health Organization and it is one of the most cities that causes the world climate change :

My name is Mohamed Yousry . I am a Mechatronics engineer. i grew up in  Cairo  where breathing air for one day =smoking 20 cigarettes . i always censured my parents generation for ruining our situation and letting air that polluted.

but i Realized that i must stop blaming and start to change the future , because we can't reverse what happened in Egypt. 

so i decided with a Group of engineers to make a positive change.  i believe with your help We can change how the story ends. 


  • Waste mismanagement is one of the major causes of air pollution in Cairo, citizens burning trash everywhere because there is no other way to get rid of it. This video shows exactly our situation https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IYfyFnEPnIQ&amp... 

  • We are a group of Egyptian engineers decided to start collecting the trash and recycle it, we will video record every area (before and after) cleaning , to inspire people to start recycling and save their lives .



The incident that inspired me to take an action :

i decided to fight air pollution in Cairo, when mother of my dearest friend died young from lung cancer ( she never smoked a cigarette) , once i saw how much  he and his family suffered , and found it's our wrong attitude, all of us that killed her ,     i felt guilty and will never forgive myself until i change the attitude of burning trash  and i will .

With helping us You will give thousands of people the chance to breathe clean air ,  you can save many of humans, animals and plants from dying by air pollution.
Every change in Egypt’s air affects the whole earth (we aim to a positive change in earth for earth and all the living creatures, starting from here, EGYPT)

That's how beaches are in Egypt


Our schools and streets



Where does my contribution go?

  • Waste Plastic Recycling Machine = $10,000 , to recycle the trash and prevent burning it

  • Special clothes and masks for collecting trash = Est. $250

  • Leasing space for the equipment (one year) = $3400

  •  Indiegogo.com charges a 4.0% fee for funds you raise + 5% PayPal taking for transferring = 1350 $

  • your contribution will make a positive change in our fight against air pollution and climate change , And it will decrease the suffering and death of all creatures.

why we choose our goal to be 15,000$ ?

15,000$ is the lowest amount to start the recycling movement , we believe the change was never about money its about idea , about believing to make a change .

-what is the impact of breathe free project on the world ? 


Our project is going to change air quality of Cairo , where Cairo is one of the most polluted cities in the world , every positive change of its air quality affects all the world and will affect positively those two sad facts :                                      

  •  7 million person die every year all over the world by air pollution, where also millions of birds, animals and plants suffer to death .                                                         
  • Climate change is the most threatening disaster to all the creatures on earth , it is going to end the lives of all human beings .


"we are the first generation to feel the impacts of climate change and  the Last generation can do anything about it "  

Many creatures extincted through the whole history , because they haven't the knowledge and couldn't communicate with each others to unite for ending the disaster threatening them to extinction.

The Effect of climate change on Earth :

  • Sea levels have risen between four and eight inches in the past 100 years. Current projections suggest that sea levels could continue to rise between 4 inches and 36 inches over the next 100 years.

  • approximately 100 million people live within three feet of sea level. Sea level rise associated with climate change could displace tens of millions of people in low-lying areas – especially in developing countries.


                        


    • Climate change threatens one-fourth of the Earth's species to be headed for extinction by 2050 .

               


  • Climate change brings health risks to the world's most vulnerable communities.

    The World Health Organization (WHO) estimates that climate change may have caused more than 150,000 deaths in the year 2000 alone, with an increase in deaths likely in the future.

  • Rising temperatures and changing patterns of rain and snow are forcing trees and plants around the world to move toward polar regions and up mountain slopes.

  • Climate change will cause storms, hurricanes and tropical storms to become more intense.


Scientific research indicates that climate change will cause hurricanes and tropical storms to become more intense — lasting longer, unleashing stronger winds, and causing more damage to coastal ecosystems and communities .


Scientists point to higher ocean temperatures as the main culprit, since hurricanes and tropical storms get their energy from warm water. As sea surface temperatures rise, developing storms will contain more energy.



By your :

  • Donations .
  • sharing our campaign on your social media (Facebook,twitter,.........) .
  • And asking your best Friends personally to donate .
We can have a future, breathe free,decrease the pollution at Cairo the most polluted city in Africa (one of the most polluted in the world)  , decreasing the huge number of death by air pollution which is 7 million person and make a positive change against climate change .

References :

  1. http://www.voanews.com/content/a-13-2008-06-09-voa57/403529.html
  2. http://www.ehow.com/list_6902484_causes-air-pollution-egypt_.html
  3. http://www.who.int/phe/air_quality_q&a.pdf
  4. http://www.who.int/mediacentre/factsheets/fs313/en/   
  5. http://www.nature.org/ourinitiatives/urgentissues/global-warming-climate-change/threats-impacts/index.htm

story:
My name is Roderick “ Berger “  Worgs. I work as a beekeeper in Downtown Kingston 12, Jamaica. Despite the fact that this area is known for being the birthplace of reggae music, it is also a socially and economically marginalized place where people are struggling to ensure their basic needs. A few years ago I decided to develop this inner city bee farm, first because beekeeping is my passion, but also because I strongly believe that it could help the community in many ways. In five years the apiary has grown from one colony to one-hundred-and-five colonies of strong bees mainly through the practice of self-reliance. I am now asking for a little help to bring this bee farm, a project very close to my heart, to the next level.


  • Saving bees

By being one of the main pollinating insects, bees play a key role in the reproduction of many plants including fruit and seeds plants. Unfortunately bee colonies have been globally declining over the past few years mostly because of pesticide overuse, pollution, global warming and resistant parasites. Responsible beekeeping helps to increase the bee population and contribute to a more sustainable eco-system in the area. 

  • Providing healthy food

Besides being sweet and tasty, honey is a good antibacterial and antioxidant product. It also contains fructose which is a natural energy booster. Bees produce honey but, as mentioned previously, they are also essential to local crops such as mangos, ackees, apples, jack fruits, etc. They are therefore a precious partner to local agriculture.

  • Sharing knowledge with youth

This bee farm provides a great opportunity to engage young people from the community in an environment-friendly project by sharing bee faming knowledge via basic trainings and workshops. Hopefully, bee farming skills will be augmented and youth employment enhanced in an area that suffers from a lack of employment opportunities.

  • Positive Impact on the community

Through this crowdfunding project, I hope to raise awareness of the farm’s existence and invite people from all horizons to come and visit us. This initiative will create an avenue of friendship between people from both Jamaica and other countries, and the citizens of Kingston 12.


On the path to achieve this project, several unfortunate events have slowed its development. Some of the terrible experiences which I had to overcome include:

  • The impact of the current drought, which has been trashing Jamaica’s southern regions, in the aftermath of hurricane Sandy on October 24, 2012. This drought, a global warming phenomenon is an affliction on the output of honey, beeswax, bee pollen and propolis, it has brought grief to bee farmers in many parishes of Jamaica.
  • The stealing of working tools and equipment by thieves whose access to these items occurs as a result of the non-existence of perimeter fencing at the bee farm.
  • The loss of JM$ 280.000 worth of bee-farming equipment as a result of a bush fire which occurred at the farm on February 27, 2015.
  • The absence of state funding for the development and growth of Jamaica’s micro and small business sector.
  • Inadequate private funding from day one, a factor that restricted the apiary’s growth potential in a very significant way.

Although these obstacles were hindering this journey, I was still able to hurdle them all. I can proudly declare that I have exhibited the competence to protect and defend my assets against all challenges. I am therefore qualified, poised and ready to take the next step to ensure greater productivity.


  • To develop the bee farm to an excess of three hundred colonies within the next three years.
  • To launch a workshop for the youth of the community.
  • To replace gears which disappeared in the fire.
  • To rear new colonies at six different locations across the northern region of Jamaica where there’s adequate rainfall.
  • To produce and extract a minimum of 500 gallons of honey annually.
  • To produce a minimum of 500 pounds of bees wax annually.
  • To harvest bee pollen for distribution as a health food commodity.
  • The rearing of queen bees for the export market.
  • To complete erection of the perimeter fence which is now under construction.
  • To purchase a second hand vehicle for the transportation of the farm's products.



By your kind contributions a Kingston 12 bee farm will expand, the ecology of our communities will improve, basic training in bee farming skills will be augmented and youth employment enhanced.

Together, we will be saving bees and making the community sweeter! Many thanks and « nuff » respect to all the people who contribute to worthy causes such as this!

Blessings.

Roderick

story:
Short Summary


In June of 2016 I will be traveling, with a small team from Pittsburgh to a village called El Huizachal in San Luis Potosi, Mexico to work with Dr. Luis Hurtado and local Pamé farmers to continue the design and planting of a network of forest gardens. We began these plantings in 2015 and have been asked to come back and continue the process. Forest gardening uses the natural forest ecosystem as guide to grow fruit, nut, vegetable and even fiber and animal crops. This year our team will include permaculture instructor and farmer Darrell Frey, author of Bioshelter Market Garden, Jessy Swisher from Pennsylvania Association of Sustainable Agriculture, as well as skilled team members from Garfield Community Farm. 

Food Forests are diverse, multilayered food production systems that maximize potential harvests and environmental benefits while minimizing labor inputs. A food forest or forest garden can provide food for many decades while improving soil conditions and increasing biodiversity and habitat. Food forests are also one of the most traditional and ancient forms of indigenous agriculture, and so we are learning from Pame of central Mexico while assisting them in creating new food forests in their fields.

In 2014 The Open Door Presbyterian Church sent my family to further our partnership with Luis Hurtado and the work he is doing as a doctor with the Pamé.  The Pamé people have been an oppressed and often impoverished people. We believe their food security and future well-being lies with their own talented farmers and not the multinational companies that  bring processed foods from the big cities. We've learned that many of the villagers are ready and willing to learn new and ancient ways of doing ecological farming that will better their land and allow for a more diverse and nutritious diet. 

In 2014 and later in 2015 we brought our experience of running a three acre urban farm in Pittsburgh and my work as a permaculture designer to teach ideas of food security, forest garden design and communal-self sufficiency. We helped plant three gardens in the village, planted dozens of fruit trees, and also planted ideas that have taken root over the last twelve months. 

Our efforts over this two week planting project will include fruit and nut tree selection, planting and education for the villagers. Some of the species will include guava, guanabana, mango, avocado, strawberry tree, tamarind, papaya and more! 


What We Need

To complete this work in a short amount of time we hope to raise $10,000.

- $5000.00 Travel, Housing, Food for Team of Ten for Two Weeks

- $1000.00 First Year Trees, Shrubs and Tools

- $2000.00 Water Catchment Systems for Three Garden Installs 

- $2000.00 Funds for Future Installations with Additional Pamé Farmers

The Impact

Over the past eight years The Open Door Church has been developing three acres of abandoned urban property into a diverse vegetable and fruit producing landscape. We have also been building relationships and teaching sustainable agriculture in El Huizechal, Mexico for about six years. Our work in 2016 will focus on fruit and nut tree care, planting of new species and replanting of those species showing the most promise. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please consider sharing this campaign with others who might like to help us! We believe in the project and we are excited that you may join us in whatever way you can!

story:
The Coalition of Kpando Youth Groups and Associations invites you to join with us in cleaning up our environment and to celebrate our community and our culture. 

This is our 4th year in presenting our Make Kpando Beautiful program.

Our vision is a clean and beautiful Kpando that we are all proud of and caring for. 

Make Kpando Beautiful 4 seeks to educate and sensitize our communities and families on the importance of environmental cleanliness to their health and well-being.

The United Youth Club of Kpando- Konda  successfully launched our inaugural MAKE KPANDO BEAUTIFUL program in 2011 with partnered support from our community youth groups and the Kpando Municipal Assembly.  Today, we are proud to say that the United Youth Club voluntarily transferred the organisation of this event to a community coalition of 14 Youth and Family Clubs and Associations in order to promote transparency and improve efficiency - embedding the ownership more broadly with our people. 

We are working hard each year to make the program more relevant.  We are working to demonstrate our commitment to the change needed in our attitude and behaviors to make our community clean and healthy.

For Make Kpando Beautiful 4 we will:

1. Work with our Junior High schools from mid November to educate them on –   Recycling + Reusing = Waste Reduction,

2. Present our 4th Community Cleanup Day in all Kpando Townships on Saturday December 13th 2014, and

3. Host a Borborbor concert after the Community cleanup to celebrate the work and aspiration of our youth and community. 

We are Ewe people from the Volta Region and Borborbor is our unique music and dance, it is important for us to re-establish the connection between culture and how we look after ourselves and our environment - http://www.bridgingdevelopment.org/culturepages/musicpages/borborbor.htm . 

Your support will enable us to:

1.  Produce the educational resource material needed for  the schools program,

2.  Purchase safety tools and protective gear for the volunteer workers for the clean-up day,

3.  Present a high standard Borborbor concert that we will  all be proud of,

4.  Promote our program and vision across our Municipality to ensure maximum awareness and participation, and

5.  Provide acknowledgement and endorsement to our youth  and community that what we do is important and that we MUST be responsible through our actions for ensuring a clean and beautiful environment.

We seek a total amount of three thousand US dollars ($2,400 ) – we trust and count on your kind support for the successful running of this project

Through the mentored support from our Patron Mr Tony Duke from Australia/USA, we have grown from strength to strength and now boost our confidence to aspire for more challenging projects. 

The Kpando Municipal Assembly has invited our Coalition to sign a Public-Private Partnership Agreement; which is scheduled to happen in late 2014. This will enable us to grow as a Community and provide an ongoing framework for our Youth to model leadership with our People.

As the Youth we are taking a role as Leaders in our community and we are working together with the different youth groups, schools, sports clubs and individuals to lead by example. Five members are now geared up to partake in governance in the municipality and getting prepared to contest in the upcoming local assemblies election.

Indeed we can make the difference, WE WILL MAKE THE DIFFERENCE.

Each of us can do something small something local that when considered together is something big something global. Please join with us to MAKE KPANDO BEAUTIFUL.

If you are unable to donate please share our program and aspiration with your friends and family – Indiegogo has share tools that will assist this or send them an email with this link or phone then and tell them about us or call by and share our story and page.
story_txt:
The Coalition of Kpando Youth Groups
and Associations invites you to join with us in cleaning up our environment and
to celebrate our community and our culture. 
This is our 4th year in presenting
our Make Kpando Beautiful program.
Our vision is a clean and beautiful
Kpando that we are all proud of and caring for. 
Make Kpando Beautiful 4 seeks to educate and sensitize our communities and families on
the importance of environmental cleanliness to their health and well-being.
The United Youth Club of Kpando-
Konda  successfully launched our inaugural MAKE KPANDO BEAUTIFUL
program in 2011 with partnered support from our community youth groups and the
Kpando Municipal Assembly.  Today, we are proud to say that the United
Youth Club voluntarily transferred the organisation of this event to a
community coalition of 14 Youth and Family Clubs and Associations in order to
promote transparency and improve efficiency - embedding the ownership more
broadly with our people. 
We are working hard each year to make
the program more relevant.  We are working to demonstrate our commitment
to the change needed in our attitude and behaviors to make our community clean
and healthy.
For Make Kpando Beautiful 4 we will:
1. Work with our Junior High schools from mid November to educate them on –   Recycling + Reusing = Waste Reduction,
2. Present our 4th Community Cleanup Day in all Kpando Townships on Saturday December 13th 2014, and
3. Host a Borborbor concert
after the Community cleanup to celebrate the work and aspiration of our youth and
community. 
We are Ewe people from the Volta
Region and Borborbor is our unique music and dance, it is important for us to
re-establish the connection between culture and how we look after ourselves and
our environment - http://www.bridgingdevelopment.org/culturepages/musicpages/borborbor.htm . 
Your support
will enable us to:
1. 
Produce the educational resource material needed for  the schools program,
2. 
Purchase safety tools and protective gear for the volunteer workers for the
clean-up day,
3. 
Present a high standard Borborbor concert that we will  all be proud of,
4. 
Promote our program and vision across our Municipality to ensure maximum
awareness and participation, and
5. 
Provide acknowledgement and endorsement to our youth  and community that what
we do is important and that we MUST be responsible through our actions for
ensuring a clean and beautiful environment.
We seek a total
amount of three thousand US dollars ($2,400 ) – we trust and count on your kind
support for the successful running of this project 
Through the
mentored support from our Patron Mr Tony Duke from Australia/USA, we have grown
from strength to strength and now boost our confidence to aspire for more
challenging projects. 
The Kpando
Municipal Assembly has invited our Coalition to sign a Public-Private
Partnership Agreement; which is scheduled to happen in late 2014. This will
enable us to grow as a Community and provide an ongoing framework for our Youth
to model leadership with our People.
As the Youth we
are taking a role as Leaders in our community and we are working together with
the different youth groups, schools, sports clubs and individuals to lead by
example. Five members are now geared up to partake in governance in the
municipality and getting prepared to contest in the upcoming local assemblies
election. 
Indeed we can
make the difference, WE WILL MAKE THE DIFFERENCE.
Each of us can
do something small something local that when considered together is something
big something global. Please join with us to MAKE KPANDO BEAUTIFUL.

unable to donate please share our program and aspiration with your friends and
family – Indiegogo has share tools that will assist this or send them an email

story and page.

story:
Legal Services to the Public, for the Public Good 

My name is Kellie Furr, and I am an Oregon-licensed attorney living in Portland. Today I ask you to support me in launching the first crowd funded private-public interest environmental law firm in Oregon! 

A private-public interest law firm has attributes of both a non-profit organization and a private law firm.  It typically has a mission dedicated to the public good, while maintaining a profit-generating arm of services that are harmonious with public interest ideals.    

My firm will focus on protecting the environment and those most impacted by its degradation by engaging both the public and private sectors through public interest litigation and by providing meaningful, sustainable economic opportunities for all.  By providing such opportunities for sustainable development, particularly to disadvantaged communities, we create in each individual a meaningful relationship of trust and ownership with the natural environment - we create a stake in its protection.  

And by helping me get my services to the public, you will in turn help combat environmental destruction and create sustainable economic opportunities. 

Please watch my video* and contribute today! 

How Can You Help?

To successfully launch this firm, I am seeking $7,500.00.  Suggested contributions are $25, $50, and $100, but more is always welcome!  Funds raised will be used toward the following: 

  1. One year of Professional Liability Fund malpractice insurance, which is mandatory all Oregon-licensed attorneys. 
  2. Marketing, branding, and website creation. 
  3. Assorted legal, accounting, and business software and small pieces of office equipment. 
  4. Residency at Hatch Innovation Lab after my fellowship tenure ends. 

For every $100 raised past my funding goal, I will donate one hour of pro bono legal assistance to a Pacific Northwest environmental organization. 

If I don't reach my goal, I will use every dime raised to try to get this venture started in whatever capacity I can.  However, the more we raise, the sooner we can impact the environment together! 

The Impact

Our environment is at a crucial point - if we act now, we can reduce or even reverse much of the harm we have caused the land, water, air, and our non-human cohabitants.  But we need more than our broken regulatory system to make a difference - we need to create meaningful economic opportunities in sustainable business.  My firm will both combat current environmental destruction through litigation and promote future sustainable development through economic empowerment.  

Risks & Challenges

There are always risks when starting a new business venture.  As a profit-generating entity my firm will not be utilizing grants, so I will have to quickly generate profit to continue to feed this firm.  But I am equipped for success: 

  1. As a solo practitioner, I am able to keep my costs lean and eventually expand by bringing like-minded, entrepreneurial lawyers into the fold. 
  2. I am flexible in my services.  I will offer private sector services within my level of competency if those services are harmonious with the firm's stated public interest ideals. 
  3. I have a team of marketing professionals dedicated to helping me spread the word about my services. 
  4. I am tirelessly committed to making this private-public interest practice work. Every failure will be a lesson, and every day will be another step forward. 

Other Ways You Can Help

I personally understand how hard it is for some of you out there.  If you can't personally contribute, please:

  1. Forward this campaign using Indiegogo's sharing tools to people you know who love the environment as much as I do and may have an interest in contributing. 
  2. Donate your services!  If you do marketing, branding, web design, or have any knowledge that you think would be useful in building my business, I would appreciate it! 
  3. Cook me a tasty treat!  Long hours are on their way...

Thank You!

Thank you to all of the friends (new and old), colleagues, and family who have provided me with such amazing support throughout this journey.  You inspire me to roll up my sleeves and do this work.  

So let's make history in Oregon and be the first to crowd fund such a uniquely structured law firm.  Thank you for participating in the Sharing Economy with your contributions! 

Together, we can positively impact our world.

Disclaimer

By making a donation to me, Kellie Furr, via Indiegogo.com, you acknowledge 

that your donation does not establish any attorney-client relationship with me, nor does your donation guarantee that you will receive legal representation.  Additionally, your donation to me does not give you any capital, equity, or similar ownership interest in any entity formed using donations from Indiegogo.com.

*Transcript:  A transcript of my video can be found here on my blog, Public Interest Northwest.

story:
Get me to DC to Sit-In at the White House and Stop the Tar Sands Pipeline

Civil Disobedience at the White House has been called to protest the proposed construction of TransCanada's Keystone XL tar sands oil pipeline. Let me carry your voice of opposition to this pipeline, to DC. Help me get to DC.


Why I feel I must protest the Tar Sands Pipeline:

As the climatologist Jim Hansen...explain(s), if we have any chance of getting back to a stable climate “the principal requirement is that coal emissions must be phased out by 2030 and unconventional fossil fuels, such as tar sands, must be left in the ground.” In other words, he added, “if the tar sands are thrown into the mix it is essentially game over.”  - Invitation letter to DC, read the whole letter here: http://www.tarsandsaction.org/invitation/


President Obama will be deciding on a presidential permit for TransCanada's Keystone XL pipeline, August 20th - Sept 3rd, and that is when we will be there, risking arrest to stop the construction of this pipeline. Read the letter of invitation signed by Bill McKibben, Naomi Klein and others here: 

http://www.tarsandsaction.org/invitation/

To learn more about tar sands, try this article from National Geographic:

http://ngm.nationalgeographic.com/2009/03/canad...

How I am participating

I am going to be in DC for three days, the first day to participate in a civil disobedience training, the second day to sit-in at the White House and risk arrest, and the third day to deal with any legal issues.

Because the stakes are so high, I am not only planning on being in DC, but I'm also organizing a caravan to get other people there. Check it out here:  www.notarsandscaravan.org.  I was hoping to set this site up to raise money for my trip on the caravan, but because I must work and must finish school, I will resort to taking one day instead of seven, to get to DC. I am encouraging caravaners to set up their own fundraising page in order to raise money for themselves, and thus the cause, and also to spread the word and offer people who can't attend the protest, a way to get involved by putting their money to work for good. I appreciate any and all help you can offer!

Get me to DC

I'll be in DC  from August 21st - August 25th. I just bought my ticket for $458, but for all practical purposes I do not have this money. School starts August 25th, and I need this almost $500 to live on when I am in school. If you can't be in DC and wish you could, help me go in your stead. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Come to the Protest! Learn more and sign up here: http://www.tarsandsaction.org/ If you want to also donate to the larger effort, click the Tar Sands Action "Donate" button.

Spread the word about the protest! Like it on facebook, send an email out to all your friends. Again, go here http://www.tarsandsaction.org/ and click "Spread the Word."

Spread the word about the No Tar Sands Caravan which will leave from the west coast and travel across the country making stops along the way to hold events and attract the press: http://notarsandscaravan.org/


My Deepest Gratitude and Love!

story:
Shortcut URL: http://igg.me/at/Sterling-to-Yildiz-demo

 

THANKS SO MUCH FOR ALL YOUR SUPPORT



FULL DESCRIPTION:

Could it really be true that there is such a thing as an all-magnet motor that can provide rotational torque for useful energy generation, with no apparent input other than what nature provides through principles of magnetism not yet fully understood? Modern science emphatically says "NO", but many inventors over the years have claimed to have defied that prediction, by building working motors.

Now, at the upcoming 41st International Exhibition of Inventions in Geneva from April 10-14, 2013, the world may have a chance to see such a motor.

The Turkish patent office has invited inventor Muammer Yildiz, to whom they awarded such a patent, to display his all-magnet motor at that expo; and he has invited me to participate in that event.

As many of you who follow our Free Energy News know, I've been closely tracking the Yildiz all-magnet motor for the past few months, both in keeping a blog about it at PESWiki updated, as well as in helping to facilitate things through my interactions with the various players, including the inventor; his assistant, Halil Turkmen; the documentary film maker, Rene van der Woude of http://www.mixr.nl; Dr. Jorge Duarte of Eindhoven University, who has been vouching for this technology; and a guy, who for now prefers to remain anonymous, from another university who is helping to coordinate the scientific validation; among others involved in coordinating this.

We all, especially the inventor, are anxious to finally see this technology class vindicated once and for all, to never be doubted again.

This would be the beginning of a new scientific and energy revolution -- a paradigm crasher, an eye opener, and the opening of a new path forward in providing clean solutions to the world's energy problems.

With all the interactions I have had on this, many of them confidential, I am very certain about the reality of Mr. Yildiz's motor design being real.

And I'm crossing my fingers that the technology will be able to get at least a minimal level of validation at the Geneva expo.

Most of the people I mentioned above have been probing around on this, and have a significant list of reasons why they are confident that the technology works.

What we can do, versus what will actually be displayed, has been the topic of much discussion behind the scenes, taking a wide range of variables into consideration, including politics of science, noise levels in the expo hall, safety issues, electronic magnetic memory erasing issues, feasibility of a scientifically credible environment for validation, possible alternate locations for moving the unit from the hall to a secondary location, feasibility of moving the set-up.

One of the limiting factors is that though the motors work, they have been built on a low budget and don't always have the best possible components, such as the bearings needed to withstand the forces generated. Though well advanced from the duct tape and bailing wire stage of prototyping, they are not ready for full-on stress testing.

While he is on this trip, following the Geneva expo, Mr. Yildiz wants to take the motor(s) to a university for proper scientific testing, and he doesn't want to jeopardize their operation by trying to show off too much at the expo. Nor does he want to risk the chance of a malfunction during a public display. So he is playing it very cautious.

 

In terms of capability, being very conservative, we could show one motor running the whole time, turning an alternator to power a 1000 Watt bank of lights.

What such a demonstration needs to prove is that for the size of the motor, there isn't anything in today's known scientific literature that could be concealed inside the motor that could possibly keep it running for as long as it is shown to be able to run.

The skeptics have been assuming that Mr. Yildiz has some kind of energy storage inside the motor cavity, by which he can show the shaft turning, but that he has not shown it running for long enough to rule out a hidden energy storage mechanism.

For the size of the motor, the most likely energy storage would be lithium ion batteries. And if the motor body was full of lithium ion batteries, the amount of power it could produce would be 1700 watt-hours. So in order to fully satisfy the skeptics, the demonstration of Yildiz' motor needs to be for at least long enough to surpass that amount of power; and most of them would want to see ten times that much before being fully convinced. So two hours of running continuously, producing 1000 Watts, would do the trick of showing at least as much power as any lithium-ion batteries packed inside the body could provide.

A likely iteration will be the fan blade that Yildiz usually uses to demonstrate the technology. That motor body will be 14 cm in diameter and about 21 cm long, and the fan is 25 cm in diameter. At the speed he runs it, that load is around 380 Watts. So to at least match the lithium-ion battery scenario, he would need to run it for 4.5 hours. And if it was still running at full speed at the end of that time, most skeptics would be scratching their heads, though not fully satisfied.  But after 45 hours, they would have to admit there is something to this.

The expo hall will be open for 9 hours each day, so even if we were only able to do the fan, running the entire time, each day, that would be 2x what present technology is capable of providing.

I've been pushing hard to have a secondary location where we could enable continuous running of at least one motor for the entire 5-day event.

Yildiz says that the longest he has ever run a motor without stopping was fifteen days, with witnesses. But he needs witnesses willing to go on record, with credentials.

In Geneva, in addition to the university personnel who plan to come, we can also have others sign in and sign out, with their signature and credentials, to add to the list of witnesses of the technology running continuously. And by having a tag-team type of pass-off by always having someone else take over where they left off, a net duration can be established, with many overlapping witnesses throughout.

Open Source?

Another reason I would like to attend the Geneva expo will be to meet in person with Mr. Yildiz and talk through the possibility of having an open license for people to be able to pursue lower power versions of the design without an up-front license, with the stipulation that they remit a royalty on all commercial roll-outs. He has been very favorable so far in these discussions. My being there in person would be particularly important in seeing this to fruition.

 

BUDGET:

$1,547.00 - Flight [Actual: 1,041.90, from booking earlier])
$1,333.00 - Hotel for 9 days
$500 - Food
$100 - Transportation
$200 - Misc. buffer
$184 - Fundraiser fee

$3864 - Total

Adjusted to raise: $3087 (We can't change total after campaign starts, so Sterling paid $777 into the fundrasier on March 25, to get it back once the campaign is funded, or refunded if the campaign doesn't meet the goal by at least 80%)

 

PROJECT GOALS:

Enable Sterling to attend the Geneva Inventors expo, to help Mr. Yildiz with his demonstration of the magnet motor technology. Enable Sterling to personally witness a working all-magnet motor for the first time, with proof of its validity, along with anyone else who wishes to observe online or attend the expo. Enable Sterling to discuss terms with Mr. Yildiz of open sourcing. Enable Sterling to speak at a press conference to be held announcing the accomplishment. Prove to the world that a new, clean energy modality has arrived, launching a new scientific and economic revolution.

 

PROJECT MILESTONES:

- Arrive in Geneva
- Help set up demo, with a possible secondary location
- Help collect witness signatures
- Help interface between universities and Yildiz to meet validation requirements
- Surpass the minimum duration to rule out hidden storage capacity
- Surpass that by many times
- Establish terms for open license
- Demo much higher output capability for short durations
- Post plans for open license of lower output versions (e.g. < 5 kW)
- Press conference announcing success and ramifications

 

RISKS AND CHALLENGES:


- Mr. Yildiz could be stopped in his transport across international borders, despite having documentation from the Turkish patent office stating the purpose for the round trip.
- The motor(s) could be damaged during transport to the event.
- Mr. Yildiz could encounter problems assembling the system.
- The Expo venue may have rules (noise, safety) that disallow continuous operation of the motor.
- Webcams could malfunction, interrupting continuous observation by Internet audience.
- Mr. Yildiz may opt out of a secondary location because he wants to be present.
- Mr. Yildiz could opt to not demo the technology for a sufficient period of time.
- Mr. Yildiz could cancel the demo and only display the hardware.



FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS:

Q. If you don't raise the amount needed for the trip, what happens to the funds?
A. The pledge is not collected if the goal is not met by at least 80%.

Q. If the 25-cm fan is attached and run at the usual speed (producing a 380 Watt load), how long will the motor need to run to rule out a hidden storage capacity?
A. 4.5 hours.

Q. If the same motor is attached to a 1000-Watt load (e.g. bank of lights) via an alternator, how long will the motor need to run to rule out a hidden storage capacity?
A. 102 minutes.

Q. How are you calculating the storage capacity?
A. One reader pointed out that: "According to Wikipedia, Li-Ion batteries can have a volumetric power density of 1900 J/cm3. With the given dimensions of 14 cm diameter x 21L, the motor body can contain approx. 3200 cm3 * 1900J = 6139 kJ of energy if it was packed with Li-Ion batteries.  If the batteries fully discharge in 24 hrs, the power output would be about 71Watts on average." That comes to 1704 Watt-hours.

Q. Where can we watch the streamed version of the demo?
A. The streaming location will be announced at PESWiki.com, among other places.

Q. How much does it cost to attend the Expo?
A. Media gets in free. The admittance fee for the general public is CHF 14/day with no previous registration.

 

IF WE SURPASS GOAL...

If we happen to surpass our fundraising goal, some of the things the excess could go to include:

  • Help with demo expenses in Geneva
  • Help with open license launch expenses
  • Donate to help Yildiz file for PCT patent coverage (not his idea; he does not like receiving funds, but is stubbornly independent, not wanting to give wrong impression about his motives)
  • Maintenance of PES Network
  • Expanding PES Network
  • Ability to assist other inventors

 

SEE ALSO

YILDIZ MAGNET MOTOR FOOTER

  • Directory:Muammer Yildiz Magnet Motor
  • Event:2013:Yildiz_Magnet_Motor_Demos
    • January | February
    • Classifieds:2013:Yildiz_Magnet_Motor_Demo_Needs

MAGNET MOTORS FOOTER

  • Directory:Magnet Motors
  • News:Magnet Motors
  • PowerPedia:Magnetic motor – encyclopedic entry
  • Directory:Linear Magnet Accelerators
  • Directory:Magnetism
  • Directory:Magnets

Now, at the upcoming 41st International Exhibition of Inventions in Geneva from April 10-14, 2013, the world may have a chance to see such a motor. The Turkish patent office has invited inventor Muammer Yildiz, to whom they awarded such a patent, to display his all-magnet motor at that expo; and he has invited me to participate in that event.
As many of you who follow our Free Energy News know, I've been closely tracking the Yildiz all-magnet motor for the past few months, both in keeping a blog about it at PESWiki updated, as well as in helping to facilitate things through my interactions with the various players, including the inventor; his assistant, Halil Turkmen; the documentary film maker, Rene van der Woude of http://www.mixr.nl; Dr. Jorge Duarte of Eindhoven University, who has been vouching for this technology; and a guy, who for now prefers to remain anonymous, from another university who is helping to coordinate the scientific validation; among others involved in coordinating this. We all, especially the inventor, are anxious to finally see this technology class vindicated once and for all, to never be doubted again. This would be the beginning of a new scientific and energy revolution -- a paradigm crasher, an eye opener, and the opening of a new path forward in providing clean solutions to the world's energy problems. With all the interactions I have had on this, many of them confidential, I am very certain about the reality of Mr. Yildiz's motor design being real.  And I'm crossing my fingers that the technology will be able to get at least a minimal level of validation at the Geneva expo. Most of the people I mentioned above have been probing around on this, and have a significant list of reasons why they are confident that the technology works. What we can do, versus what will actually be displayed, has been the topic of much discussion behind the scenes, taking a wide range of variables into consideration, including politics of science, noise levels in the expo hall, safety issues, electronic magnetic memory erasing issues, feasibility of a scientifically credible environment for validation, possible alternate locations for moving the unit from the hall to a secondary location, feasibility of moving the set-up. One of the limiting factors is that though the motors work, they have been built on a low budget and don't always have the best possible components, such as the bearings needed to withstand the forces generated. Though well advanced from the duct tape and bailing wire stage of prototyping, they are not ready for full-on stress testing. While he is on this trip, following the Geneva expo, Mr. Yildiz wants to take the motor(s) to a university for proper scientific testing, and he doesn't want to jeopardize their operation by trying to show off too much at the expo. Nor does he want to risk the chance of a malfunction during a public display. So he is playing it very cautious.
 
In terms of capability, being very conservative, we could show one motor running the whole time, turning an alternator to power a 1000 Watt bank of lights.  What such a demonstration needs to prove is that for the size of the motor, there isn't anything in today's known scientific literature that could be concealed inside the motor that could possibly keep it running for as long as it is shown to be able to run. The skeptics have been assuming that Mr. Yildiz has some kind of energy storage inside the motor cavity, by which he can show the shaft turning, but that he has not shown it running for long enough to rule out a hidden energy storage mechanism.
For the size of the motor, the most likely energy storage would be lithium ion batteries. And if the motor body was full of lithium ion batteries, the amount of power it could produce would be 1700 watt-hours. So in order to fully satisfy the skeptics, the demonstration of Yildiz' motor needs to be for at least long enough to surpass that amount of power; and most of them would want to see ten times that much before being fully convinced. So two hours of running continuously, producing 1000 Watts, would do the trick of showing at least as much power as any lithium-ion batteries packed inside the body could provide. A likely iteration will be the fan blade that Yildiz usually uses to demonstrate the technology. That motor body will be 14 cm in diameter and about 21 cm long, and the fan is 25 cm in diameter. At the speed he runs it, that load is around 380 Watts. So to at least match the lithium-ion battery scenario, he would need to run it for 4.5 hours. And if it was still running at full speed at the end of that time, most skeptics would be scratching their heads, though not fully satisfied.  But after 45 hours, they would have to admit there is something to this. The expo hall will be open for 9 hours each day, so even if we were only able to do the fan, running the entire time, each day, that would be 2x what present technology is capable of providing. I've been pushing hard to have a secondary location where we could enable continuous running of at least one motor for the entire 5-day event. Yildiz says that the longest he has ever run a motor without stopping was fifteen days, with witnesses. But he needs witnesses willing to go on record, with credentials. In Geneva, in addition to the university personnel who plan to come, we can also have others sign in and sign out, with their signature and credentials, to add to the list of witnesses of the technology running continuously. And by having a tag-team type of pass-off by always having someone else take over where they left off, a net duration can be established, with many overlapping witnesses throughout.Open Source? Another reason I would like to attend the Geneva expo will be to meet in person with Mr. Yildiz and talk through the possibility of having an open license for people to be able to pursue lower power versions of the design without an up-front license, with the stipulation that they remit a royalty on all commercial roll-outs. He has been very favorable so far in these discussions. My being there in person would be particularly important in seeing this to fruition.
 
BUDGET: $1,547.00 - Flight [Actual: 1,041.90, from booking earlier]) $1,333.00 - Hotel for 9 days $500 - Food $100 - Transportation $200 - Misc. buffer$184 - Fundraiser fee
$3864 - TotalAdjusted to raise: $3087 (We can't change total after campaign starts, so Sterling paid $777 into the fundrasier on March 25, to get it back once the campaign is funded, or refunded if the campaign doesn't meet the goal by at least 80%)
 
PROJECT GOALS:
Enable Sterling to attend the Geneva Inventors expo, to help Mr. Yildiz with his demonstration of the magnet motor technology. Enable Sterling to personally witness a working all-magnet motor for the first time, with proof of its validity, along with anyone else who wishes to observe online or attend the expo. Enable Sterling to discuss terms with Mr. Yildiz of open sourcing. Enable Sterling to speak at a press conference to be held announcing the accomplishment. Prove to the world that a new, clean energy modality has arrived, launching a new scientific and economic revolution.
 
PROJECT MILESTONES:
- Arrive in Geneva - Help set up demo, with a possible secondary location - Help collect witness signatures - Help interface between universities and Yildiz to meet validation requirements - Surpass the minimum duration to rule out hidden storage capacity - Surpass that by many times - Establish terms for open license - Demo much higher output capability for short durations - Post plans for open license of lower output versions (e.g. < 5 kW) - Press conference announcing success and ramifications
 
RISKS AND CHALLENGES:
 - Mr. Yildiz could be stopped in his transport across international borders, despite having documentation from the Turkish patent office stating the purpose for the round trip.- The motor(s) could be damaged during transport to the event. - Mr. Yildiz could encounter problems assembling the system. - The Expo venue may have rules (noise, safety) that disallow continuous operation of the motor. - Webcams could malfunction, interrupting continuous observation by Internet audience. - Mr. Yildiz may opt out of a secondary location because he wants to be present. - Mr. Yildiz could opt to not demo the technology for a sufficient period of time. - Mr. Yildiz could cancel the demo and only display the hardware.
 FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS:Q. If you don't raise the amount needed for the trip, what happens to the funds? A. The pledge is not collected if the goal is not met by at least 80%.Q. If the 25-cm fan is attached and run at the usual speed (producing a 380 Watt load), how long will the motor need to run to rule out a hidden storage capacity? A. 4.5 hours.Q. If the same motor is attached to a 1000-Watt load (e.g. bank of lights) via an alternator, how long will the motor need to run to rule out a hidden storage capacity? A. 102 minutes.Q. How are you calculating the storage capacity? A. One reader pointed out that: "According to Wikipedia, Li-Ion batteries can have a volumetric power density of 1900 J/cm3. With the given dimensions of 14 cm diameter x 21L, the motor body can contain approx. 3200 cm3 * 1900J = 6139 kJ of energy if it was packed with Li-Ion batteries.  If the batteries fully discharge in 24 hrs, the power output would be about 71Watts on average." That comes to 1704 Watt-hours.Q. Where can we watch the streamed version of the demo? A. The streaming location will be announced at PESWiki.com, among other places.
Q. How much does it cost to attend the Expo?A. Media gets in free. The admittance fee for the general public is CHF 14/day with no previous registration.
 
IF WE SURPASS GOAL...
If we happen to surpass our fundraising goal, some of the things the excess could go to include:

Help with demo expenses in Geneva
Help with open license launch expenses
Donate to help Yildiz file for PCT patent coverage (not his idea; he does not like receiving funds, but is stubbornly independent, not wanting to give wrong impression about his motives)
Maintenance of PES Network
Expanding PES Network
Ability to assist other inventors
 
SEE ALSO

story:
The Alunaris Project seeks to inspire love for majestic trees at the foothills of the most irreplaceable park for threatened species.


"Life is made of dreams, and that project is one I want to see come true" - Bruno Monteferri, Conservamos por Naturaleza


I am a conservation scientist and installation artist.

I love majestic trees - and work to protect them. As a scientist, I examine the effectiveness of forest conservation projects (www.cnolte.com). As an artist, I invite people to experience majestic trees in new ways (article). 

Trees are the structural pillars of the diversity of life on Earth. Growing in perpetual movement towards the sky, they hold mountains in place, feed rivers, harness the sun, enable animals to move, and plants to grow.

Majestic trees can support entire life worlds in their crowns – and centuries of memories in their bodies. And they are extraordinarily powerful in making people think - about their own role on this planet.


The Place

Last year, a Science study identified the "world's most irreplaceable park for threatened species": A pyramid on Colombia's coast, 18700ft high, Noah's Ark. The indigenous inhabitants call it the Heart of the World.

Majestic trees from tropical rainforests to montane clouds? I had to see them.

Yet, after weeks of hiking the area with local guides, I realized there weren't many majestic trees left. Logging, marijuana, cocaine, and herbicides had almost wiped out valuable tree species. Now peace had arrived and tourism was expanding, fueling new demand for timber.

It felt like it was time for a statement. One of love for living majestic trees.


The Project

The Alunaris project is such a statement.

It starts this summer. With an inspirational tree house.

Our intention is to create a mindblowing experiential structure - a tree temple, if you will - recalling and celebrating the role of trees in maintaining life memories.

Accessible to the public for part of the day, the tree temple will allow visitors to spend the night (see perks). Imagine waking up to the sounds of toucans and monkeys, with a sweeping treetop view... 

It will be built between the branches of a majestic higueron. Stabilized with enormous buttress roots, the tree is strong, beautiful, yet not a threatened species. It stands on a small plot of collective land, just outside the national park and indigenous land.

(That guy in the photo is 6'4" tall.)

Once the tree temple exists, it will support plantings of rare rainforest trees, new tree house projects with the indigenous, tree expeditions, photography, performances, and installations.

We are in for the long haul. This is the Heart of the World.

Read the full story at www.alunaris.org


The Team

The Alunaris tree house will be built by a group of committed nature lovers : Conservation scientists, tree climbers, gardeners, circus artists, videographers. We welcome volunteers, and spread the word on Couchsurfing and Workaway.


What We Need

Your contribution makes the inspirational tree house possible. Every cent goes directly to materials. Work is donated by myself, friends, and volunteers (join us!). Needs include:

  • Tree-friendly attachment devices (Garnier Limbs): $1600
  • Sustainably sourced wood: $3500
  • Stainless steel cabling for ladder and support: $500
  • Long lasting rain cover: $500
  • Nuts, bolts, tools: $500
  • Bed, shower, compost toilet: $1000
  • Decoration, paint: $400
  • Solar lighting: $200
  • Tree access equipment: $500
  • Calories for the 4-6 people build team: $1300


The Impact

Located at the base of probably one of the most important ecological corridors in the world the Alunaris Project creates an inspirational trigger point for those who want to bring back old trees to the Heart of the World. It will also serve as the base camp for tree projects, research and expeditions further up the mountain.

I have dedicated the last 13 years to conservation studies, research and art. I see this as a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to make a difference.

Read more at www.alunaris.org.


What You Get

Every $100 donation gives you one unforgettable night in the tree house - with a companion of your choice. Experience the magic of the place - and dream away in the embrace of a majestic tree.

Each night is transferable (it makes a beautiful gift ...) and valid for as long as the tree house is up (we design it for an estimated lifetime of at least 30 years). Getting there.

Every donation of $25 or more puts your inspirational message on the tree house, together with your name.

Every donation of $10 or more puts your name on the website.


Other Ways You Can Help

Not able to contribute financially? Why don't you:

  • Spread the word: Share this campaign with your friends.
  • Come to Colombia this summer and join the build team!

story:
The Plant Exchange is a philosophy, an event, a place, a community, and a way of life!

Our free events increase public access to horticultural materials that can be used for urban gardening, beautification of blighted neighborhoods and community spaces like public schools, senior centers, and even livening up work spaces. We collect donated plants, trees, soil, yard art, patio furniture, tools, and equipment. The flagship program is the semi-annual event where neighbors, gardeners, landscapers, and beginners come to share their bounty, extra supplies, and information with other garden enthusiasts. And, all for free! 

​The Plant Exchange is a non-profit community service organization that reduces the impact of plant waste on the environment by serving as a central clearinghouse for the plant industry to donate excess materials that would otherwise go into landfills and compost piles. We recycle, re-home and re-distribute.

Now in our 10th year, we’ve grown from a fledgling local neighborhood front yard endeavor to the largest event of its kind in Northern California. Over the last three years, The Plant Exchange has grown from 450 participants per event to 1,200; and we expect 1,500 attendees this fall.

What's in a truck?

The demand is outpacing our wildest dreams! We want to give you what you’ve been asking for: more plants, more education, more often! Every week we get 2 to 3 donation pick-up requests from landscapers, nurseries and plant leasing companies that we have to turn away.  Renting moving trucks and using volunteers to help has now reached its limit.  In order to accept these larger donations of plants and supplies we must purchase a moving truck of our own.

We already “have” two of the four wheels!

StopWaste of Alameda County recently recognized our long history of outstanding community-building work and conservation efforts by providing a $12,000 matching grant to support the purchase of our own 14-foot moving truck! This grant gets us halfway to our target. We need double that amount to buy all four wheels, which is why we are reaching out to you – our friends, supporters, community partners, and our wider plant-loving family – to ask for your support so we can raise the additional $12,000 needed to purchase our dream vehicle.

Together, we can take the Plant Exchange

From this....

To this....

What difference will a truck make?

Together, we will:

  • Save 24,000 more plants annually through our system of exchanges.
  • Influence and change local horticulture businesses disposal practices by re-homing and re-distributing their excess – a more environmentally friendly and sustainable solution.
  • Share the love by doubling the number of locally grown plant items donated monthly to other non-profits and community centers including libraries, schools, health clinics, senior and low-income housing, and more.
  • Spend fewer resources on renting vehicles, saving time and money that will instead go into advancing our mission to keep our environment healthy.

Truck yeah; we can do it!

We welcome and deeply appreciate any size contribution. Check out our wonderful donor thank you gifts. Won’t you help us spread the word?

  • Tell all your friends when you donate and encourage them to give to our campaign.
  • Share a link on your favorite social media platforms.
  • Post on a community board or at work.

Trucking Beautiful

And, if we exceed our $12,000 goal by another:

  • $750 – we can purchase  25 folding tables to display plants at our spring and fall events. 
  • $1,000 – we will add signage to the truck to advertise our events and services. 
  • $2,500 – we can erect a 20 ft. x 20 ft. outdoor shed to store the additional tools, gardening accessories, and supplies we will now be able to pick up. 

About Your Donation

We are a 501(c)3 non-profit organization. When you donate you will receive a letter showing your donation amount along with the fair market value of the gift. The difference between those two figures is the amount the IRS allows you to declare on your taxes.  

If you choose to donate and not take a gift, then the entire amount of your contribution is tax-deductible. 

When you donate, you aren't just making a monetary contribution. You are becoming part of The Plant Exchange family. Join us today and become part of this ever-growing gardening movement.

story:
GREEN C.A.S.L CAMPAIGN
Join us to celebrate & raise our initial funding for the ranch!

  • SHIPPING CONTAINERS - 8K BASE GOAL
  • MOBILE SOLAR ARRAY - 16K STRETCH GOAL
  • WATER CATCHMENT - 24K STRETCH GOAL


_______ABOUT____________________________

Green C.A.S.L (JenkStars Ranch)

The Green C.A.S.L. project began six years ago by “The JenkStars”; a group of like-minded artists and activists. Green C.A.S.L has grown into one of Southern Utah’s hubs for art, sustainable living, and activism. Our privately owned and managed 40 Acre property is nestled in the stunning valley of Green River, Utah approximately 10 miles from the city of Green River, 1 mile to water source and 3 miles to the beach.

Several times a year, this ranch plays host to events where people from throughout the region and across the country come to learn about next-level technology, alternative energy, sustainable living, and healing arts. Through community outreach and sustainably driven events we educate people by providing them with real tools, real skills, and real solutions. Our event workshops have included solar cooking, cob building, water catchment, aquaponics, and more.


_______FUTURE____________________________

The Green C.A.S.L 40 acre ranch is utilized as a community retreat where ideas are shared and steps to act are taken. The Green CASL project exhibits working systems which demonstrate a healthy, sustainable lifestyle in an artistic and engaging way. The Jenkstars would like to continue to build a facility to host events on a regular basis that are an interesting and educational example of how to utilize resources. Not only do these events benefit the participants, they also benefit the local Green River community by boosting the economy and generating a larger dialogue and awareness about the local environmental issues. Our team is excited to take this project to the next level. The Jenkstar Ranch is already favored by hundreds of people as an incredible space and a beacon of hope. Undoubtedly, it becomes “home” for everyone who visits. We educate and inspire, spreading the message of sustainability through each ripple of awareness that takes hold. We see a grand horizon of several hubs located on the 40 acre property as retreat spaces, learning centers, event domes, greenhouses, and several hands on workshops each year.


_______THE GOAL____________________________

Our goal is to raise funds for the Green C.A.S.L (Center for Art and Sustainable Living) to being to purchase our core pillars for building a sustainable center. The JenkStars Initial goal is to purchase shipping containers for building equipment, material, and tool storage. When returning to the ranch we have a safe place to store equipment. If we reach our goal we would like to stretch to purchase a Mobile Solar Array, and if we meet that goal we would like to stretch even further and implement our water catchment design.  The shipping containers will serve as the foundation for the learning center, providing both structure and storage for ongoing projects involving art, sustainability, and community. 


_______INDIEGOGO CAMPAIGN GOALS____________________________

SHIPPING CONTAINERS - 8K BASE GOAL

The shipping containers will provide securely locked storage for equipment, material, and tools.


MOBILE SOLAR ARRAY - 16K STRETCH GOAL

This system will power dwellings & learning centers as well as travel to events around the area promoting the viability of solar and other alternative energies. 


WATER CATCHMENT - 24K STRETCH GOAL

The water catchment system will provide water for future greenhouses, retreat spaces, dwellings & learning centers. It will serve as an example of how to capture and use rain water in dry climates.



_______JENKSTARS____________________________
Technology has evolved rapidly over the last several years,  and so have the Jenk Stars. Each year we create larger and more interactive installations with found and reclaimed material, pushing the limits on what is possible with “Jenk". (J'ank- n. lost, discarded or broken material that is given new life.)

The Green C.A.S.L 40 acre ranch is utilized as a community retreat where ideas are shared and steps to act are taken. The Green CASL project exhibits working systems which demonstrate a
healthy, sustainable lifestyle in an artistic and engaging way. The Jenkstars
would like to continue to build a facility to host events on a regular basis
that are an interesting and educational example of how to utilize resources.
Not only do these events benefit the participants, they also benefit the
local Green River community by boosting the economy and generating a larger
dialogue and awareness about the local environmental issues. Our team is
excited to take this project to the next level. The Jenkstar Ranch is already
favored by hundreds of people as an incredible space and a beacon of hope.
Undoubtedly, it becomes “home” for everyone who visits. We educate and
inspire, spreading the message of sustainability through each ripple of
awareness that takes hold. We see a grand horizon of several hubs located on
the 40 acre property as retreat spaces, learning centers, event domes,
greenhouses, and several hands on workshops each year.
_______THE GOAL____________________________
Our goal is to raise funds for
the Green C.A.S.L (Center for Art and Sustainable Living) to being to purchase
our core pillars for building a sustainable center. The JenkStars Initial goal is
to purchase shipping containers for building equipment, material, and tool
storage. When returning to the ranch we have a safe place to store equipment. If
we reach our goal we would like to stretch to purchase a Mobile Solar Array,
and if we meet that goal we would like to stretch even further and implement
our water catchment design.  The shipping
containers will serve as the foundation for the learning center, providing both
structure and storage for ongoing projects involving art, sustainability, and
community. _______INDIEGOGO CAMPAIGN GOALS____________________________
SHIPPING CONTAINERS - 8K BASE
GOAL
The shipping containers will provide securely locked storage for equipment,
material, and tools.
MOBILE SOLAR ARRAY - 16K STRETCH
GOAL
This system will power dwellings
& learning centers as well as travel to events around the area promoting
the viability of solar and other alternative energies.  
WATER CATCHMENT - 24K STRETCH
GOAL
The water catchment system
will provide water for future greenhouses, retreat spaces, dwellings &
learning centers. It will serve as an example of how to capture and use rain
water in dry climates. _______JENKSTARS____________________________Technology has evolved rapidly over the last several years,  and so have the Jenk Stars. Each year we create larger and more interactive installations with found and reclaimed material, pushing the limits on what is possible with “Jenk". (J'ank- n. lost, discarded or broken material that is given new life.)

story:
We Are Sold Out for Tonight - Thanks Everyone - See you at 6pm!

 

The Alamo Drafthouse on Slaughter Lane is in the "Parkside Village" shopping center at 5701 W Slaughter Ln, Austin, TX 78749. Look for the very large building at the south end of the complex, closest to Mopac. 

Tonight's Schedule: 
6pm ... Doors
6:30 ... Musical guest
7-8 ... Presentation
8:00 ... Q&A
8:30 ... Mingle & exit

 

 

-Greetings-

 

4/27 UPDATE, 10:30am CST:

 

WE ARE SOLD OUT OF TICKETS

We will of course still happily accept donations to help cover our costs, but all 33 tickets to tonight's presentation event have been sold. We may or may not have all ticket purchasers attend, so if you're viewing this page for the first time and would like to join us this evening, please do. We'll try and find you a seat. Thanks so much, everyone!

 

##

 

This is About Solutions. 

Help us fund a live film and presentation at The Alamo Drafthouse on Thursday, April 27, 2017! Here is the story:

  • Hi, i'm Chris Searles, founder of biointegrity.net. About two years ago i started raising funds to protect and restore Earth's most biodiverse ecosystems. Why? It's the best solution to climate change and a whole lot of other things. Since starting biointegrity we've protected enough biodiversity to offset Austin TX's community-wide carbon footprint 1.6 times and are currently reducing more greenhouse gas emissions per year than $1 billion worth of rooftop solar.
     
  • The biointegrity climate solution is not just reducing emissions, we're also helping to stop the extinction crisis, protect Earth's temperate climate system, protect global life support services production where it's most concentrated, protect our global food production industries, and protect hundreds of threatened indigenous communities.  
     
  • This presentation offers a breakthrough vision for stopping the extinction crisis and winning the climate challenge in the fastest, most affordable way possible. In addition to the monumental greenhouse gas reductions we've achieved,  we're helping protect more than 15,000 species, 15 million trees, 1 billion gallons of annual freshwater filtration, and billions of microbial species. We are just getting started and we're asking for your help. 

 

 

What's In It For You. 

Break'n it down:

  • We're Seeking $1,000! 
    These funds will go to pay for the event and its filming and editing costs. We wish to raise these funds via ticket sales and donations. We have a matching grant to cover all remaining costs. Project budget available upon request. Thank you.
     
  • Here's What You Get!
    Tickets are $10. All ticket purchasers receive a ticket to the event. Dinner not provided at this time. Please note, however, this is a pretty exclusive event. There are only 33 seats available (first come, first serve). You may choose to "keep" or "donate" your tickets. Donated tickets can be given to a specific person or put into our donated tickets bucket for release to special guests.

    All attendees have the chance to win an Alamo Date Night Package (2 movie passes, 2 popcorns, 2 drinks), donated by the Alamo Drafthouse. We'll give this away during the event. Good luck!

    Our funder bonuses: offset your carbon footprint for life, protect the most biodiverse ecosystem on Earth, help one of the world's oldest indigenous communities retain rights and control over their ancestral lands, and get you a free drink from the Alamo's beer, wine, cocktail, soda, coffee, or tea menu. 
     
    All ticket purchases of $20, $50 or $100 also get: 
    • Free drink ticket ($10 value) for our event
    • Amazon acres protected in their name (2, 10, or 20)
    • A PDF Contributor's Report commemorating your gift to this project and highlighting the most outstanding impacts of the acres protected in your honor (We'll email this to you)
  • Help Us Spread the Word! 
    By helping us you're helping the world. Thanks again, please share this with your friends.  

 

 

You Can Afford to Save the World. 

If our IndieGoGo campaign is 100% successful we'll protect at least 100 acres of the most biodiverse region of the Amazon, have a great night at the Drafthouse, cover most of our expenses, and make a great video. 

Here is more information about how helping biointegrity helps the world:

  • These Acres are Special. The acres we've chosen to protect in your honor, should you choose to purchase a ticket for $20 or more, and help us produce this event:  
    • Are integral to Earth's climate system. 
    • Contain a minimum of 250 tons of forest-stored CO2 per acre. 
    • Shelter the headwaters of the Amazon River, the world's largest river. 
    • Reduce global greenhouse pollution by more than 1 ton per acre, per year. 
    • Will combine to protect more than 1.3 million acres, and connect together 7.8 million acres, of the most biodiverse ecosystem on Earth. 
    • Are home to at least 3,000 to 4,000 plant species, 1,000s of insect species, more than 500 bird species, 80 amphibian, species, and 100s more reptile, mammal, and other species. 
    • Are home to one of the Amazon's most ancient indigenous communities, The Secoya people. 

 

 

The Power of Supporting BioIntegrity. 

So far, our supporters have helped protect nearly 80,000 acres of places like this region of the Amazon, resulting in a net Ecological ROI of: 

  •   +15 million trees  – protected
  •   +23 million tons tree-stored CO2 – protected
  •   Billions & billions of microbial species – protected
  •   +100 threatened indigenous communities – co-protected
  •   +68,000 tons annual carbon sequestration – protected
  •   +15,000 threatened plant & animal species – protected
  •   +1 billion gallons annual freshwater filtration – protected

Learn more: biointegrity.net annual report.

 

 

Risks & Challenges.

Can't think of any downsides! We're asking for your help funding this project. We hope to fill all 33 seats, but who knows? ... We may go SRO!

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help.

If you can't contribute, you can still help:

  • Please post this page this to your social media. Send a special note to a friend, colleague or loved one who might be interested. And don't forget the Indiegogo "share" tools located on this page. 

That's all there is to it!
