story:
Protecting Kibagare

A fragile ecosystem sits in the midst of concrete buildings in Nairobi. It is an ecological haven stretching over 10 acres of land, with unique tree, plant and bird species, and it is a source of income for an estimated 300 plant and pot sellers in the area.

For many years, renowned Kenyan environmental activist and 2004 Nobel Peace Prize winner, the late Professor Wangari Maathai, fought to protect this wetland from powerful developers, and she succeeded.

Now, 3 years after her death, the Presbyterian Church of East Africa has plans to turn the wetland into luxury apartments. Not only is this a disgrace to Professor Maathai's decades of work, but it will also destroy the trees, the birds and the livelihoods of the people who depend on the wetland.

The plan to build apartments contravenes findings by the National Environmental Management Authority that no construction should occur on a wetland, as well as a consultation in 2010 which found that members of the public were strongly against the development. A 2001 Environmental Impact Assessment by a geographer from the University of Nairobi found that developing the land could result in Kibagare river flooding into informal settlements such as Mathare.

We are a group of activists and environmental groups, including the Centre for Environmental Action and the Coalition for Constitution Implementation. We have been campaigning to protect the wetland for several months, but so far, construction has started and no action has been taken either by the government or by others tasked with protecting such areas in Kenya.

We want to file a case in court and we have a lawyer, but we need funds to cover his legal fees and the costs of filing the case.

What We Need & What You Get

  • As we all know, court cases are expensive affairs. We are aiming to raise $3000. All this money will go toward the court case. This will include the lawyer's fees of approximately $1500, filing fees of $1000 and $500 for documentation.
  • Any outstanding amount will go toward the campaign we are building - to inform people about Kibagare and other wetlands under threat and to raise the profile and urgency of the issue.
  • Donations within Kenya can be made via MPESA at 0724 568 164.

The Impact

Your support is of immense importance: in helping us to protect a vital and unique ecosystem and in safeguarding the livelihoods of the people who depend on the wetland. 

If we succeed, this struggle may also set a precedent for other wetlands and ecosystems under threat across Kenya.

Risks & Challenges

We are aware that we are up against powerful people. On the other hand, we have a relatively new and progressive constitution and we have the chance to build the support that will strengthen our case.

And, whether or not this case succeeds, it will still buy us time to continue the campaign while the construction is stalled. We can continue to create networks, publicize the issue and bring people together.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Get the word out there! Share on social media and with your networks as far as possible. For more information about the issue, please see: http://www.pambazuka.net/en/category/advocacy/92418
  • If you can, call the World Council of Churches (+41 79 507 6363/
    +41 22 791 6704) or the World Communion of Reformed Churches (+49 511 8973 8310), to ask why their partner, the Presbyterian Church of East Africa, is destroying a wetland to build apartments.
  • Join us - we are a small group with few resources. We need all the support and help we can get!

Thank you! -Cidi Otieno, Tetu Maingi, Zahra Moloo and CEA

story:
Short Summary

The atrocities being perpetrated against women and girls in the Democratic Republic of Congo (DRC) are nothing less than a femicide – the systematic destruction of the Congolese female population. Since 1996, sexual violence against women and girls in the Eastern DRC has been used as a weapon of war to torture, humiliate and destroy not only women and girls, but entire families and whole communities. Since the conflict began, hundreds of thousands of women and girls have been raped. Many members of the female population within the region have endured sexual slavery, kidnapping, unlawful detention, recruitment of young girls into armed forces.

As Panzi Hospital is presently the only referral hospital in North and South Kivu, V-Day and UNICEF in partnership with Panzi Foundation are currently building a special facility for the survivors of sexual violence, at the City of Joy.  Conceived, created and developed by the women on the ground, the City of Joy in Bukavu, Democratic Republic of Congo will support women survivors of sexual violence to heal and provide them with opportunities to develop their leadership through innovative programming. Through its groundbreaking model, the City of Joy will provide up to 180 women a year with an opportunity to benefit from: group therapy; storytelling; dance; theater; self-defense; comprehensive sexuality education (covering HIV/AIDS, family planning); ecology and horticulture; and economic empowerment.

The City of Joy will provide women a place to heal emotionally as they rebuild their lives, turn their pain to power, and return back into their communities to lead.  Construction began in August 2009, in Bukavu, DRC, on the City of Joy and it was opened in 2010.

This Community Solar in DRCongo project, will add an 8kW solar electric system, that will:

  • Introcduce solar technology to the community.
  • Take the community off dependence of diesel fuel. 
  • Train the women on solar installation and maintenance.

WHAT WE NEED

My company will provide, the material and equipment for the solar system, and support 3 days of my time.   All funds ($6000 needed) raised through Indiegogo will go towards (10 days) travel, VISA's, accomodations, transport, safe passage, labor and misc. costs to install and energize the solar system.  A financial report of spending will be submitted to every donor after the Project.

The Impact

The solar system will immediately reduce the cost of energy to the faciltiy, the savings can be used for other purposes.  The system, also introduces a technology that has not been accessible to this community.  Therefore the project is also a demonstation of how solar technology works, and thus allowing the users to think about how to adapt it to their lives.  At this point, energy, should be a human right, this project is demonstrating how it can be made a reality.

Other Ways You Can Help

1. Please stay informed about the Women & Girls situation in DR Congo and advocate for them in any way you can, especially discussing and sharing about their plights with friends. 

2. Visit this site http://drc.vday.org/get-educated to get further information.

3. Follow the developments on Facebook (Scientific Depelchin) and http://drc.vday.org/home.html

story:
Summary

The purpose of the Yes on M Open Space Access initiative is to maintain access to 540 acres of popular public recreation areas and focus positive development on the urbanized footprint of former Fort Ord (near Monterey, California).

This piece of land includes more than 50,000 beautiful California coast live oak trees.

Our goal is to stop big-money developers who want to defeat this initiative and over-ride the base reuse plan to allow a horse race track on Fort Ord. Their plan will devastate this natural area and have other harmful environmental and social consequences.

  • Who are we? We are a group of citizen activists who want to preserve this important piece of land in Monterey County.
  • What have we already done? We successfully put this initiative on the ballot, and now it's up for vote in the Nov 5 election.
  • Why do we need your help? We're up against big-money developers who are trying to defeat Measure M. We need your help to fund a successful campaign and get the message across to every voter in Monterey County who values environmental conservation and positive development!

To learn more about this initiative, visit our website: Fort Ord Access Alliance

What We Need & What You Get

  • Running a successful campaign takes financial resources. We are a grassroots group and we've been volunteering hundreds of hours to help this important initiative pass. Just getting the initiative on the ballot was a huge victory! To do this the right way, we need extra help to bring on media professionals and others who can help communicate the importance of the November vote. That's where you come in!  
  • Our goal is to raise at least $15,000 by October 31st to pay for these campaign expenses so that we can stop the development plans for this land and save the 50,000 California live oak trees that are on it.
  • We've got some great perks if you help us out with a donation to this campaign... make sure to look at the sidebar to the right.

The Impact

Even if you don't live in the Monterey area, you may know what a beautiful and rare natural setting this is. We are up against big-money developers who want to level this land and put in a horserace track as well as 1,500 residential units, hotels, a commercial center and more. 

Here's the bottom line: Your donation will make the difference in this critical campaign.

Our resources are limited -- that's why we are putting out this call for help to people around the world who care for the environment and want to preserve it from reckless development. Please give us a hand!

Your contribution of any size is deeply appreciated! And if you contribute at the levels of $25, $500, or $1000, we've got some great ways to say thanks to you! See the perks in the sidebar to the right.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute money right now, here are some other ways you can help that will make a big difference:

  • Help us get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.
  • Share this campaign via your Facebook, Twitter, and Google+ pages.
  • If you're a voter in Monterey County, make sure to vote Yes on Measure M on November 5! (And No on Measure K!)


To learn more about this initiative, visit our website: Fort Ord Access Alliance

Photo: Skip Moss

The purpose of the Yes on M Open Space Access initiative is to maintain access to 540 acres of popular public recreation areas and focus positive development on the urbanized footprint of former Fort Ord (near Monterey, California).
This piece of land includes more than 50,000 beautiful California coast live oak trees.
Our goal is to stop big-money developers who want to defeat this initiative and over-ride the base reuse plan to allow a horse race track on Fort Ord. Their plan will devastate this natural area and have other harmful environmental and social consequences.

story:
Our Story

We are the Friends of the Ontario Ranger Program.

The Ontario Ranger Program (ORP), formerly the Ontario Junior Ranger Program, was founded in 1944 and provided an opportunity for young workers to gain first-hand knowledge of resource management through a work and learning experience. More than 70,000 Ontario youth have participated in the 70-year old program.

In September 2012 the Liberal government - without prior public consultation - cancelled the program and shut down all 13 camps across the province. Now, Premier Kathleen Wynne’s government has committed $295 million dollars in the 2013 provincial budget for youth employment. Restoration of the Ontario Ranger Program fits the employment mandate for young people.

The Friends of the Ontario Ranger Program (FORP) is a group that aims to empower young people of Ontario to advocate for the full restoration of the Ontario Ranger Program. The goal is to demonstrate to all Ontarians that the Ontario Ranger Program is an integral part of the Ontario Public Service. FORP aims to find a positive and effective way to restore the program so the integrity and spirit of the Ontario Ranger Program can continue for future generations. Our objective are simple:

The FORP want to:

• Build awareness that the program has been discontinued

• Demonstrate by example the importance of Ontario Rangers Program

• Convince Premier Kathleen Wynne and the Minister of Natural Resources, David Orazietti to reinstate the program.

What We Need & What You Get

In an effort to promote our campaign and to raise awareness, the FORP are hosting a weekend Jamboree Reunion in Huntsville, ON on August 24, 2013.

This Jamboree will include speeches from Ranger Alumni and a celebrity guest, ranger memorabilia and The Friends of the Ontario Ranger Program (FORP) have volunteered to build an education trail.The trail is part of the Waterloo Summit Centre for the Environment and will feature minimum edge effects and minimum habitat fragmentation so the various types of wildlife will use this area as their home. The trail will connect the local community more to their natural environment.

The trail building will be an example of the kind of work being lost with the cancellation of the Ontario Ranger Program.

For further details about the eco-trail building event check out: www.savetherangers.ca

Your generous donations will go towards funding all aspects of the event including, but not limited to: facility rental fees, advertising and promotional costs, and beyond the Jamboree to help move this campaign forward as we will continue to fight for this incredible program. 

The Impact

The impace of your donations will be seen and felt in many different ways. Our main goal is to have the Ontario Ranger Program reinstated, to bring back this incredible opportunity to another 70,000 youth, and then another 70,000 more after that. 

The immediate impact of your donation will be seen at the Jamboree in Huntsville on August 24th. By donating anything you can, you will be providing the Friends of the Ontario Ranger Program with the resources they need to make this event a suceess in spreading awareness of the program and ways people can help. 

The long term impact by your donation today, will help FORP keep this campaign going and growing by continuing advertising and promoting via the internet, social media and paper media and more awareness events like the Huntsville Jamboree Reunion.

Other Ways You Can Help

There are so many other ways you can help us win this fight should you not be able to contribute a financial donation. We encourage everyone to spread the word, write letters to your local MP's and Premeir Wynn with your reasons why the Ontario Ranger Program needs to be reinstated. For information and contact information, please visit our website:

www.savetherangers.ca

story:
The first Colombia Birdfair (Taking place in Cali, Colombia, February 13-16, 2015 ) is being hosted by the Asociación Río Cali, a non-profit organization that works with rural communities for the conservation of the biodiversity of the Upper Cali River watershed, contiguous to the Farallones National Park, one of the most biologically diverse parks on the planet. Conservation of the watershed is of critical importance to preserve the habitat of a very diverse flora and fauna (many of them endangered) and to ensure the provision of ecosystem services for a population of about 3,000,000 people.

La primera versión de Colombia: Feria de Aves, se realizará en la ciudad de Cali del 13 al 16 de Febrero, 2015 es organizada por la Asociación Río Cali, una entidad privada sin ánimo de lucro que trabaja con las comunidades rurales para la conservación de la biodiversidad en la cuenca alta del río Cali, zona de influencia del Parque Nacional Natural Farallones de Cali, uno de las áreas naturales más biodiversas del planeta. La conservación de la cuenca del río Cali es de suma importancia para preservar el hábitat de muchas especies de fauna y flora (algunas de ellas muy amenazadas) y para asegurar los servicios ambientales para una población cercana a los 3 millones de habitantes.

The Colombia Birdfair has as a goal to promote the conservation of the birds and their habitats in the Upper Cali River Watershed and to promote ecotourism in Cali and its rural areas as a strategy towards sustainable rural development and the conservation of the biodiversity of the area. The fair will provide a space where birders, conservationists, students, academics and the general public can enjoy the fascinating world of birds with their families, and at the same time help promote their conservation. All funds raised during the Colombia Birdfair will go towards the purchase of land that will allow for the establishment of a nature reserve, providing for the conservation in perpetuity of more than 250 species of birds, many of which are endangered.

Colombia: Feria de Aves tiene como meta promover la conservación de la aves y sus hábitats en la cuenca alta del río Cali y promover el turismo de observación de aves en las zonas rurales de Cali como estrategia de conservación de la biodiversidad y de desarrollo rural sustentable. La Feria pretende ser un espacio donde observadores de aves, conservacionistas, académicos y el púbico en general puedan con sus familias aprender y disfrutar del fascinante mundo de las aves, a la vez que fomenta su conservación. Todos los fondos recogidos durante la feria serán destinados a la compra de tierras que permitan el establecimiento de un reserva natural en la cuenca alta del río Cali, propiciando la conservación a perpetuidad de más de 250 especies de aves, muchas de ellas amenazadas y en peligro de extinción.

This campaign will raise funds to get the project started with a website, brochure and marketing campaign in order to leverage more funds from sponsors and government agencies. It also aims to get the word out about the fair and promote participation in the fair by birders and nature lovers from around the globe.

Esta campaña espera recolectar los fondos necesarios para iniciar la primera versión de la Feria de las Aves de Colombia. Los dineros recolectados se destinarán para el diseño y creación de la página web de la feria, un brochure y campañas de mercadeo para buscar más fondos con sponsors y agencias gubernamentales. Igualmente pretende promover la participación en la feria de amantes de la naturaleza de diferentes rincones del mundo.

What We Need/Que Necesitamos

This campaign will raise funds to promote Colombia Birdfair at a national and international level.

$2,000 to create a webpage in order to market the Colombia Birdfair to audiences all around the world.

$4,000 to design and print 4,000 copies of our promotional brochure.

$4,000 to distribute the brochure to birding festivals in the US and Europe.

$5,000 to secure lodging and meals for the national and international speakers invited to the fair.

All funds received will be used to leverage more funds from sponsors and government agencies.

Esta campaña tiene como finalidad captar fondos para la promoción de la Colombia: Feria de Aves a nivel nacional e internacional.

$2,000 para crear la página web y promocionar la feria en Colombia y el resto del mundo.

$4,000 para diseñar e imprimir 4,000 copias del brochure promocional.

$4,000 para distribuir el brochure en ferias de aves internacionales.

$5,000 para asegurar los gastos de hospedaje y alimentación de los conferencistas internacionales y nacionales invitados a la feria.

Todos los fondos recibidos en esta campaña serán usados para asegurar más fondos con sponsors y agencias gubernamentales.

The Impact/ El Impacto

Your donation will help our dream of the first Colombia Birdfair become a reality and ensure that a very special biodiversity hotspot is preserved for future generations. We hope to plant the seed for hosting a Birdfair every two years and energize the community to work on future conservation projects (including the purchase of a reserve and construction of a top-class birding lodge).

Su donación ayudará a que nuestro sueño se convierta en realidad y sembraremos una semilla para la realización de la primera versión de la Colombia: Feria de Aves y proyectos de conservación de las aves a futuro en el suroccidente de Colombia (incluyendo la compra de tierras para el establecimiento de una reserva a perpetuidad en la cuenca alta del río Cali).

If you are unable to contribute but would still like to help, please help spread the word by sharing with your networks via email, Facebook, Twitter, etc. Or if you know of folks that might be interested in attending the fair please let them know it's happening February 13-16, 2015 . It all helps! Thank you!

Si por algún motivo no nos pueden colaborar económicamente, por favor ayúdenos a difundir esta campaña con sus contactos de eMail, Facebook, Twitter y demás redes sociales. Si saben de personas que estén interesadas en participar la Colombia: Feria de Aves hágaselo saber. Recuerde que la primera versión de la Feria de Aves de Colombia se realizará en la ciudad de Cali del 13 al 16 de febrero de 2015. Muchísimas gracias!

Para los que no tengan tarjeta de crédito y quieran hacer una donación por favor consignar en la cuenta corriente de la Asociación Río Cali, 136-01150-9 Banco Davivienda, oficina Oeste (Obelisco) Cali, Colombia.


With eternal gratitude,

Con eterna gratitud,

The Asociacion Río Cali

Asociación Río Cali

story:
Short Summary

Tony and I had this grand notion that we could build from scratch a sustainable, organic farm.  Well, so far it's been hard, but with perseverance it's working!  We started with seven undeveloped acres and an old run down five hundred-square-foot hunting cabin.  The remodeled cabin became a two-room home to us and our two pugs.  We have well water, but we're still connected to the power company.  The hope is that we will be "off-grid" very soon.  Long-term we would like to setup a solar farm and provide power to our farm and our neighbors through a community solar co-op.  We use absolutely NO chemicals--pesticides, herbicides, fertilizer, etc. and we have a fantastic organic garden using only heirloom seeds and plants (No GMO here).  Nine alpaca are residing on a couple of the undeveloped acres, but they have requested a few new pastures and solar powered electricity in their barn. For you see, this is an environmentally-aware herd. Of course we would like to fulfill their request, but funding for our start-up farm is an issue.  

What We Need & What You Get

Here's the breakdown for our funding:

$1000 - fencing for two pastures for the alpaca.

$500 - solar power to the barn for fans, lights, etc.

$500 - Perks, shipping, fees.

We have FANTASTIC perks!  Fabulous hand-spun yarn, hand-knit scarves & hats, and the most unique perk of all -- mini-me dolls!  Yup -- for a $75 donation you will get a custom hand-made doll designed from a picture you send me of the lucky recipient! Have one made for yourself, your spouse, your child, your niece or nephew, grandma or grandpa, your boss---anybody!  

If we reach our goal---EXCELLENT!  But if we don't, we'll start with solar power to the barn, then move to the fencing for the pastures and get as much done as we can.

If we are so fortunate to surpass our goal--then the next step will be solar power for the pump shed!  Then we will be 100% sustainable with our water source!  Horray!









The Impact

The success of this campaign will have a HUGE impact on our farm and our community!  Having additional pastures means that we can continue to grow our alpaca herd and this means more of their wonderful fleece to process into luxurious yarn and products.  The solar power to the barn is our first step to full sustainability and our dream of a solar farm in our community.

Risks & Challenge

This whole journey has been filled with risks and challenges!  We left our four-bedroom suburban Maryland house and high-paying jobs to move to rural Mississippi in search of a more simple life, where we call the shots.  Most importantly we want to spread the message that a natural, organic, low-carbon footprint lifestyle can be accomplished, even in the most of unlikely places!  We are up to the challenge!

Other Ways You Can Help

We truly need and appreciate your financial support, but there are other ways you can help us.  Make some noise about this campaign!  Use the fantastic Indiegogo share tools to get our message out there on social media!

For you see, this is an environmentally-aware herd. Of course we would like to fulfill their request, but funding for our start-up farm is an issue.     What We Need & What You Get Here's the breakdown for our funding:$1000 - fencing for two pastures for the alpaca.$500 - solar power to the barn for fans, lights, etc.$500 - Perks, shipping, fees.We have FANTASTIC perks!  Fabulous hand-spun yarn, hand-knit scarves & hats, and the most unique perk of all -- mini-me dolls!  Yup -- for a $75 donation you will get a custom hand-made doll designed from a picture you send me of the lucky recipient! Have one made for yourself, your spouse, your child, your niece or nephew, grandma or grandpa, your boss---anybody!  If we reach our goal---EXCELLENT!  But if we don't, we'll start with solar power to the barn, then move to the fencing for the pastures and get as much done as we can.If we are so fortunate to surpass our goal--then the next step will be solar power for the pump shed!  Then we will be 100% sustainable with our water source!  Horray!The Impact The success of this campaign will have a HUGE impact on our farm and our community!  Having additional pastures means that we can continue to grow our alpaca herd and this means more of their wonderful fleece to process into luxurious yarn and products.  The solar power to the barn is our first step to full sustainability and our dream of a solar farm in our community.Risks & ChallengeThis whole journey has been filled with risks and challenges!  We left our four-bedroom suburban Maryland house and high-paying jobs to move to rural Mississippi in search of a more simple life, where we call the shots.  Most importantly we want to spread the message that a natural, organic, low-carbon footprint lifestyle can be accomplished, even in the most of unlikely places!  We are up to the challenge!   Other Ways You Can Help We truly need and appreciate your financial support, but there are other ways you can help us.  Make some noise about this campaign!  Use the fantastic Indiegogo share tools to get our message out there on social media!

story:
Our Story

Eartheart - Connecting hearts around the Earth together creating harmony and healthy environment on Earth:

  • It began many moons ago, as a deep call to action in the heart and soul.

  • The purpose of Eartheart is to reconnect humanity with it's heart centred relationship with the Earth, thereby harmonising the Earth's environment and finding ones authentic self in the process.

    Eartheart does this by offering world service events to the community, empowerment education and holding space for community to come together and grow in love (truly the greatest education of all).

  • Your contribution will assist to pay for registration fees so Eartheart can become a Not For Profit Organisation and build a new website to share what we do with the world. As we individually and collectively awaken and remember our relationship with Earth, we embody more and more contentment, joy and bliss and it spreads throughout the world and changes our environment!

What We Need & What You Get

This is what Eartheart needs right now and what's in it for YOU:

  • Eartheart requires funds to become a registered Not For Profit Organisation in Australia. 
  • As our previous website was hacked we need a new website to be built with many functions and upgraded online facilities.
  • When you contribute you can choose from one of our Super Perks such as - Free Tickets to Film Nights, Weekend Workshops or Special Events.
  • If our target of $5000 is not reached the funds raised will go directly toward the minimum deposit required by the website builder.

The Impact

Your big or small contribution will make a real difference:

  • As an official Not For Profit Organisation we can take our fundraising for Environmental causes to the next level and give back to the Earth.
  • A high impact website will assist to spread the word and connect like minded individuals on a united journey to restore our relationship with Earth.
  • Eartheart currently holds Cultural / Environmental Clean-Up events and we want the capacity to reach out to more people and volunteers - many hands achieve so much more!

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Maybe you can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't still help:

    • Please make noise!! Talk about our campaign and share it with people you know.

    And that's all there is to it.

story:
Lwande is the name of our future organization with the main goal to become the most global and helpful campaign against the global warming.

The last years we have been witnesses of many tragedies caused by the Mother Nature; but she has been the victim of our human behaivor.

We think it is not necessary to show you that the Global Warming is a fact. But if you still have doubts about it, we can show you some good articles talking about the current environmental situation.

  • Global Warming Fast Facts by National Geographic
  • Global Warming Facts by Environmental Defense Fund
  • Global Warming by Discovery Channel

And you to know more about Global Warming we can recommend you a couple of films like:

  • HOME by Yann Arthus-Bertrand (Watch the complete movie HERE)
  • An Inconvenient Truth by Davis Guggenheim
  • And many others

Also maybe you have heard that the ice of the artic is melting, but you don't have idea how fast this is happening. Please watch this video made for NOAA (National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration).

 

And the most clear proof of the huge problem we have with the global warming are the facts we can see and some people can feel in their daily life.

The question is: Do we really need to touch the bottom to realize that our actions are having bad consequences in the planet?

What will happen when our planet become uninhabitable? Do we have the techonology to colonize other planet?

Fortunately, we still can fix the situation, but this means the whole planet need to change our current lifestyle and it could delay hundreds of years to make that happen. And we don't have much time. So we need to act now and the human being has the techonology and the knowledge to counteract the global warming. How?

There are many ways to save the planet, one of the most expensive are these:

0. Implementing Renewable Energy from natural resources

Minimizing our dependence on fossil fuels can reduce carbon dioxide and methane levels in the atmosphere. Without harmful greenhouse gas emissions, renewable energy can help lead the fight against global warming.

1. Wrapping Greenland

Dr Jason Box, a glaciologist from Ohio State University, proposes wrapping Greenland in a blanket. By covering the valleys that form darker areas, therefore attracting the sun's heat, he hopes to significantly slow the melting of the glacier.

2. Hungry ocean

Dr Brian von Herzen of the The Climate Foundation and marine biologists at the University of Hawaii and Oregon State University believe that the ocean could absorb much more carbon dioxide from the atmosphere by creating plankton blooms. This is done by mixing the nutrient rich water in the colder depths of the ocean with the warmer surface water by placing huge wave-powered pumps on the swells of the North Pacific.

3. Raining forests

Consultant environmental engineer Mark Hodges believes forests could be generated by dropping "tree bombs" from a plane. The seedlings are dropped in a wax canister full of fertiliser that explodes when it hits the ground and grows into a tree. The method has already been used to regenerate mangrove forest in Louisiana after Hurricane Katrina.

4. Infinite Winds

Fred Ferguson, a Canadian engineer specialising in airships, has designed a wind turbine that will use the constant winds that exist at 1,000 feet to produce renewable energy.

5. Brighter World

Stephen Salter, an Edinburgh University engineer, believes that clouds can be created to protect the world from the power of the sun. He proposes forming clouds above the ocean by sending salt into the atmosphere.

6. Fixing carbon

David Keith, 2006 Canadian Geographic Environmental Scientist of the Year, believes he can create a machine that sucks in ambient air and sprays it with sodium hydroxide and then expels it as clean air. The carbon from the air will be captured and stored underground.

An many others...

It takes a lot of money to put some of these strategies to work.

The main problem is that nobody wants to spend their money in something that will not give any profit. Not even the governments.

Here is where LWANDE project take place

The planet belongs to each citizen of each country in the world. Today we are almost 7 billion people and at least the 30% of the global population has internet access. This means that 2.1 billion people can visit a website. In a perfect utopy, if the 2.1 billion people could visit a website against global warming and could donate or buy an item with a value of 1, 3 or 5 dollars, maybe more. The world would have more than 2.1 billion dollars to implement the technology to fix the global warming issue.

LWANDE wants to be the organization able to reach as many internet users as possible, show them the big problem we have, raise awarness on them and ask them a little donation or a purchase in order to collect funds to save the only planet we are able to live in.

What We Need

  • A unique and professional website with a very attractive design available in different languages (as many as possible).
  • A mobile app for iPhone and Android: The app will have a game, news about global warming, donation widget and tips to have a green lifestyle. The sales of the app will be part of our main goal.
  • A huge campaign on the main Social Media like YouTube, Facebook, Twitter, Google+
  • A huge campaign on Google Adwords in order to appear in the most popular search engine of the world (Google) and its ads network.
  • The attention of well-known newspapers, news channel, periodists and important organizations.
  • We need to consolidate Lwande as the organization to save the world.

As you may know, the advertising on internet could be cheap, but it is not so much when you want to reach millions of people. So, after a research the funds will be used in this way:

  • Multilanguage Profesional Website (U$3000)
    • Designer
    • Writers to create content about global warming and articles every week about the progress
    • Translators to make all the content available to the world
    • Marketers to create the best banners, videos and ads to call the attention of the users
  • Mobile App for iPhone and Android (U$3000)
  • The First Social Media campaign (U$8000)
    • With U$8,000 it is possible to drive decent traffic to Lwande (around 200,000 visitors) with this, Lwande can make some noise and grab the attention of important companies that can contribute with more advertising or by giving some help as non-profit organization. Also, it is important to remember that Social Media is social network and the growth could be viral.
  • The First Campaign on Google (U$6000)
    • With U$6,000 it is possible to drive a campaign on Google and the network of websites that use Google Adsense, this will help to bring TARGETED traffic. This means, people who is already interested about global warming and is looking for a good way to help.
  • Get A Voice On International News
    • It could be really amazing to be present on Interntional News Channel, but it could be really expensive to but some time on TV. So, the idea is to get as much attention on internet as possible, then make contact with several newspaper and news channel in order to make Lwande appear on them. With Lwande will get respect, trust, love and support.
  • Be Consolidated
    • Once Lwande become to a consolidated organization against global warming, people will be able to make a donation without hesitate that the only goal is to SAVE THE PLANET.

What will happen after?

With all the donations, Lwande will have to contact the people able to create and implement the technology to set back the global warming. Of course with the help of international organizations like the ONU and some others.

Maybe it won't be possible to reach 2.1 billion people but if we can reach 5 million or 1 million able to contribute with U$10 dollars, it is possible to make a big change.

If we don't reach the goal...

The money collected will be reinvested in order to get the total sum to make this project real. We can't keep waiting while the planet is destroyed.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not able to contribute in order to make this project a reality, please get the word out and make some noise about this campaign using the IndieGoGo share tools.

 

Why is called Lwande?

It is an acronym of three necessary things to save our world

Love, Will AND Effort

story:
SHANTI HOUSE RETREAT CENTER: PURPOSE OF CONSTRUCTION

Visit The YogaRevolution Studio website to learn more about your Campaign Perks:

www.YogaRevolutionAstoria.com

MISSION STATEMENT:

Shanti House Retreat Center is a non-profit Educational, Research and Arts institution with a mission to:
- preserve and promote the ancient Healing Arts of Yoga and Ayurveda, 
- provide the New York area Yoga Teachers and Yoga practitioners with an affordable, peaceful and holistic Yoga Retreat getaway environment  
- support the Performing Arts, in particular the Middle-Eastern art of Bellydance for its enlightened aesthetics and rich cultural heritage.

  

Shanti Retreat Center will be open to all who desire quiet, supportive space to facilitate the process of inner transformation, rejuvenation of health and creative artistic unfolding.

Shanti RETREAT HOUSE is being constructed for the purpose of:

  • providing Retreat environment for Yoga Practitioners, Yoga Teachers, Dancers and anyone with an interest in Yoga, Ayurveda and Middle-Eastern Dance

  • hosting large Group Retreats

  • serving as a quiet space with inspiring views of nature for residential Fasting and Ayurveda Retreats 

  •  

THE PROPERTY, PLANNED AMENITIES AND RETREAT PROGRAMS:

THE PROPERTY:
close to Woodstock, 2.5 -3-hour drive from Triboro Bridge. Mountains, rivers, secluded, beautiful natural surrounding.

PLANNED RETREAT AMENITIES:
-The Retreat Center property will have hiking trails, 
-a garden, 
-an outdoor wood fired barrel sauna, 
-an outdoor hot tub, 
-and a large outdoor deck for Yoga practice and 
Retreat Events in the summer months.

PLANNED ACCOMODATION AMENITIES:
Shanti House Retreat will be open through all 4 seasons, 
naturally heated with a large wood burning stove, 
and will have built-in loft space accommodations 
with up to 12 separate sleeping alcoves for Retreat guests. 
Additional accommodation space will be built on the first 
floor for another 10 guestrooms. In the summer months, 
outdoor camping facilities will also be available.

PLANNED RETREAT CENTER PROGRAMS:
- weekend Yoga and Meditation Retreats with guest Yoga Teachers
  bringing their own groups or promoted/organized through the Yurt
  House Retreat Center
- weekend Ayurvedic Detox and Rejuvenation Programs (Panchakarma)
- supervised water Fasting & Juice Fasting weekend and Residential Programs (from 1-3 weeks long)
- 200-hrs Yoga Teacher Training month-long Intensives in the summer
- Ayurvedic Spa Training Certification Courses in the summer

- Dance Retreat Intensives with guest teachers, (bringing their own groups or organized/promoted through the Yurt House Retreat 
(wall to wall mirror panels will be installed for weekend dance intensives for groups up to 25 people or more.)

 






BUILDING SPECS:

Septic System: already in place and functioning

Well Water: has already been dug and piped

Electricity: electrical pole is conveniently situated on the property, 
wiring inside the yurt will need to be implemented


Shanti House Retreat Center requires $12,000 in finishing funds for the completion of construction so it can meet our goal of commencing the Retreat's operations beginning June 2014!

PHASE I FUNDING NEEDED -- $12,000:

1) Wall Insulation for the winter  -- $5,000

2)Furniture, fixtures, wiring and plumbing inside  -- $5,000

PHASE II FUNDING NEEDED:

Succeessful Phase I Funding Campaign will be sufficient to commence The Yoga House Retreat operations beginning June 2014.

Details of Phase II Funding requirements will become available after Phase I of the Building Process has been implemented.
GOOD KARMA!
Merit is a special kind of good karma - with interest. Generosity creates good karma!

By the laws of karma, every generous act comes back doublefold.                           

Become a part of the community that is committed to promoting natural health and wellness. With everyone's help, the Building Process will be finished quickly and you will be able to come enjoy the Retreat Center come June 2014, when the Retreat Center is scheduled to commence its operations.

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP:

 

Thank you for participating with us to help the Shanti House Retreat Center commence its operations in the summer of 2014!

story:
WATER FOR THE WORLD
WaterSeer started as an innovative concept to an advanced prototype that's become a revolutionary reality. We are proud of our global outreach and we are committed to supporting non-profits worldwide where water will change peoples’ lives in ways we can only imagine today. 

                                                                INNOVATIVE DESIGN 

People always ask us how WaterSeer works and while the design is continuously being fine-tuned, the idea remains the same. WaterSeer is built to provide a reliable source of pure water using impeccable standards and modern technology.

                                                               

                                                              THE WATERSEER SPIRIT

We will never be satisfied until all people have water security and independence that they need to thrive because they have an abundance of clean water. This spirit ensures that we always challenge the status quo. Because of our efforts, future generations will get water in a unique way. And they will wonder why it was ever provided any other way. 

The future of clean water will be better because we are defining it.

For more information please go to our website: www.waterseer.org

Click Here for Product Warranty!

Follow our journey on the WaterSeer Journal as we move through the various stages of engineering, design, testing and delivery around the world. Join our WaterSeer Community and get behind the scenes access of what we’re up to!

WaterSeer™ FAQs: Please go to www.waterseer.org for updated FAQs.
story_txt: WATER FOR THE WORLDWaterSeer started as an innovative concept to an advanced prototype that's become a revolutionary reality. We are proud of our global outreach and we are committed to supporting non-profits worldwide where water will change peoples’ lives in ways we can only imagine today.                                                                 INNOVATIVE DESIGN People always ask us how WaterSeer works and while the design is continuously being fine-tuned, the idea remains the same. WaterSeer is built to provide a reliable source of pure water using impeccable standards and modern technology.                                                                                                                             THE WATERSEER SPIRITWe will never be satisfied until all people have water security and independence that they need to thrive because they have an abundance of clean water. This spirit ensures that we always challenge the status quo. Because of our efforts, future generations will get water in a unique way. And they will wonder why it was ever provided any other way. The future of clean water will be better because we are defining it.For more information please go to our website: www.waterseer.orgClick Here for Product Warranty!Follow our journey on the WaterSeer Journal as we move through the various stages of engineering, design, testing and delivery around the world. Join our WaterSeer Community and get behind the scenes access of what we’re up to!WaterSeer™ FAQs: Please go to www.waterseer.org for updated FAQs.

story:
Moving our planet in the right direction with baby steps!!! 

We congratulate Sun Country Highway for the work for greening Canada done by Kent Rathwell and his team and we would like to use his chargers to do our small part to promote EV usage and healthy lifestyle choices. The Earthship work of Michael Reynolds, the Garbage Warrior has inspired our second phase of this lifestyle change.

 

Short Summary

I am a former Canadian businessman who has transformed into a teacher/farmer and a solar engineer want-to-be. We would like to install this electric charging station on our land in Lac La Biche, Alberta, Canada for the sake of the environment and not for the sake of the pocketbook.  The earlier we get charging centres everywhere the better and where do we need it most than in the centre of oil country in Alberta, Canada.  It is simply making a negative a little more positive.

 A little while ago, I had one of the worst things possible happen to our  permaculture project and greenhouse operation.  I had invested my life savings in this small permaculture project and just finished building a greenhouse to enhance the project when we had a smelly, noisy and busy UFA 24 hour keylock gas station open up right next to where we are trying to grow fruit trees and herbs with proper permaculture methods.  It was enough to make one want to crawl back into bed or start screaming and cursing. However, I prefer to try to turn this negative into a positive even with a limited budget. 

Hence, I would like to open this solar electric charging centre with a micro-generator and flash along highway 36 with the solar panels a daily reminder as to the right way to travel.

Electric is the way of the future! Our site will be only a few meters from the gas pumps so I am hoping to run a subtle campaign with a solar charging centre that will stand out and make people take notice everytime they gas up!! Our charging centre will be seen by thousands everyday and right in the heart of oil country and will give a reminder to each person who pulls into this busy gas station that they should be going electric.

PLEASE HELP US BE SUPERHEROES TO OUR KIDS!!!!

 

THE FUTURE IS SOLAR ELECTRIC IF WE WANT TO LEAVE SOMETHING TO OUR KIDS!

 

I need $19,699 to make this work and it will be invested as follows:

Site Preparation                                          $5500

Sun Country charger(100 amp)                  $2199

signage and zonage                                   $1500

charging structure                                       $2500

 micro-generator( $partly financed)            $ 7000

volunteer work (80 hours)                           free

highway frontage (lot                                  free

FUNDING NEEDED:                                 $19,699

The Impact

This first solar charging centre in the area will be like a flagship not only to encourage EV non-polluting traffic in the area but to serve as a wake-up call to those who still think it is ok to be driving a pollution vehicle that has put our very futures in question.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people we know can't contribute financially but you can still help:

 

  •  make some noise about this campaign, tell everyone on your email and facebook sites and friends at work.
  • volunteer to help us build the centre
  • get the word out to the EV community through websites
  • donate something we can barter with as long as its green friendly
  • buy some books from us, the money goes towards this project, we have about 5000 used books towards this cause.
  •  use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
INTRODUCTION

I am Calvin Hogue, President and Founder of Musicians for Biodiversity. I first heard the word Biodiversity back in 2010 when the United Nations declared that year as the Year on Biodiversity. As I started to understand what this matter was all about, I was inspired to use the resources that I have to help get the Biodiversity message across to people.

I am the Owner of Lyfe Production, a small multimedia business. I am also a musician and host of the" DrCal Hour of Insight" on BlogTalkRadio.com which gives me access to talented musicians and artists all around the world. Realizing how music can attract people and get their attention, this is what inspired me to partner with the United Nations and to create Musicians for Biodiversity.

OUR MISSION

Our mission is to help educate and inform people about the importance of Biodiversity in an easy to understand format and friendly environment. We believe that if people understand what Biodiversity is and how important it is, it will inspire them to do whatever they can to help stop Biodiversity loss.

How we will carry out our mission

 MFB will be host events in the United States as well as other countries. These events will provide entertainment as well as information about what Biodiversity is and what people can do to help. Events will also include guest speakers from different environmental organizations that will share information on what their organization is doing and how people can get involved.

Focus on Children

Some of these events will focus on children, providing a friendly atmosphere that will engage their attention This is a very important part of our mission because children are our future and it is important to instill in them the importance of Biodiversity. This will help ensure a better future for the generations to come.

Already in Progress

In February of 2012, I began hosting a show on BlogTalkRadio.com called "From the Top" My first guest was David Ainsworth, the program officer for the United Nations Decade on Biodiversity. I have interviewed guests from many different organizations that focus on Biodiversity and other environmental issues. I believe that this show inspires and helps inform people about what is being done, and what they can do to help stop biodiversity loss.

Expenses That Need to Be Covered

Event coordination

Basic technology equipment and maintenance

Audio  and Visual equipment for events

Production of literature and paraphernalia for events

Travel expenses.

Impact

While it would be so easy for all of us just to sit back and say “ let someone else worry about Biodiversity” it is far better to do what we can now. People naturally have the tendency to only worry about their individual bottom line and what seems to be affecting them at the present moment. However this is what leads to major complications in the future. Biodiversity loss is an issue that affects all of us, not just a certain group of people. So we all need to understand the importance of Biodiversity and what we can do to conserve it.

Others ways to help

Share Indiegogo site and tools.

Contact us about hosting an event in your area.

story: Fire Damage caused our homelessness: Happy Days beginning to all. My name is Sharlene M. Sanders. My family and I currently live in Kings Mountain NC. I am representing my family in this campaign to raise the funds we need to help us through a disaster. Fire damage made our home unlivable. And for the last three weeks we have been staying with family and friends and also in a motel. Thankfully none of us were injured but the down side is making sure the children continue the rest of this school year at their existing location. The McKinney Vento law says they may continue at the same school but we didn't qualify for the Gas reimbursement. Currently the travel to and from two separate schools each day gets complicated due to the distance it is from the Waco NC home we are staying. We desperately need to get back to Kings Mountain and establish residency there. The family member we are currently living with is in the process of moving herself and is not able to help us much longer with residency. We decided to begin this campaign after a family member told us about this website. On the day of the fire we spoke to the red cross which provide us only with the option of going to a city shelter. The shelter option will stay as a last resort idea. Asking and talking to everyone we come in contact with has given us a lot of hope, but the funds needed to get a new HOME are still yet to be made. This campaign is aimed to reach $20,000 for a family of seven. Sharlene (mom) Brian (dad) Greyson (12y/o son) Ethan (6y/o son) Ian (pronounced with a long I- 5y/o son) Rhiann (3y/o daughter) and Serenity (6mo daughter) We plan to move the remaining items from our still unrepaired home into storage. After that we will pay the entire amount of $288per week to stay @ the motel we stayed right after the fire. The motel had a staff that was comprised of some very compassionate and loving people from Nassau Bahamas. We have since established a relationship with them and would love to stay there until the remaining 8 weeks of this school year is up. The motel had a full size refrigerator and stove so food preparation is possible. After school ends we will be continuing with our previous plan to relocate to MD which is my original place of birth. Our move will cost us $500. The apt complex that we are moving to has a four bedroom available that runs for $1300 per mo. Once we get to MD Brian and Sharlene will began working on our family project to open a restaurant that serves delicious home style food. We had a family food service business that delivered food to our customers here in Kings Mt. We received a great deal of support from the locals who became loyal repeat consumers of our Cheeseburgers, Fish fillet sandwiches, Loaded Hot Dogs and Pulled pork sandwiches. Because the fire damage happened in our kitchen our family decided to view it in a positive way. Instead of thinking that our business was lost we view it as a blessing in disguise. We may have been moved from continuing to serve others at this time but our efforts to open the restaurant is still in effect. We all work together to prepare the food we have each day and the children love to participate in the seasoning process. They also come up with Ideas about recipes when we are talking food. Ethan aspires to be a chef when he becomes an adult. We know he is passionate about it because he speak about it often and he is the first to ask can he help. We are very grateful for any and all blessings. We recognize them all and pray every day together. We ask that if you feel what you have read about in this message please help us to move forward and not stay in a stuck position. As a family we have decided to find a way to donate to organization that help displaced families. It was very heart breaking to see that the community organizations; who assist in crises situations, could do nothing to help us get shelter. When we move to MD and start our restaurant we are going to find out which organizations are pro-active in helping homeless families. At a time in our life we had to stay in a homeless shelter for a short time. It was a very respectful and loving environment for women and children. We learned a great deal about working together and getting through a rough situation. The stay was a positive one and we have life long friends who we met there. I promised the children that we would never have to return their again. That promise was made from the bottom of my heart and I refuse to believe that I will have to break it. Please know that your help is needed and nothing will be left unnoticed. Even if you read this and are unable to help us we ask that you share our story with others and ask them to pray for our success. We have FAITH in abundance and we know we will reach our goal. Thank you so much in advance. At this time I will share this prayer..................Lord in Jesus name we pray......Father you protect us. You LOVE us. You direct us. You reveal to us our true purpose in life. Lord make us better GOD. Make us what and who you created us to be Lord. Make us LOVING and COMPASSIONATE. Make us givers and leaders and sharers of your countless blessing. Father shelter us from negative and make us see clearly the path you will have us go. Our FAITH is full Lord and in you.......hold us through the storms and know we never rest on ungratefulness. Bless our entire life Father and strengthen our will to do your will. In Jesus name we pray Lord. AMEN!! We need your support please spread the word of or campaign- Our Indiegogo campaign link is belowhttp://www.indiegogo.com/projects/fire-damage-caused-o...

story:
We are all one. My name is Azalea named after a flower by my dad a gardener. I am a native of Oakland yet like all of us we all live in this world. As a holistic practioner and green advocate of over 18 yearsi  see people without jobs, dying of cancer, diseases, hunger, no homes, or sick homes.

We are all a beautiful melting pot of color. We deserve to live in a natural healthy environment. There came the birth of GreenSoul Movement.

"Merging Youth With Elders in Eco-education. Greensoul movement  Healing Ecovillages will be a place where there will be natural building classes and natural homes, Botany of endangered herbs and the community learning how to create products and food from these herbs and  the organic gardens, Live food classes, natural healing modalities from Africa, Asia, Australlia and around the world. Where people can come and get healing for cancer and other ailments based on donations and not because they have lack of funds.

They can live and work or stay for a while at these healing villages. Each Village will tailor to the communities needs. We are a melting pot and our ecovillages should represent this where people can learn from each others cultures, we will encourage community from local ecovillages we start such as Oakland to visit our ecovillage we will have in Ghana and merge the two together. Creating green jobs there an here using natural commodities.

Instead of eating junk food people will be taught how to make healthy foods. Creating communities starting in the bay area leading to around the world. Our goal in three years is to create 726 green jobs. Starting with the bay area.
Instead of throwing away those in the community we come together to create a solution for our people, land , animals and environment.

       Eco Programs At GreenSoul Movement Ecovillage Oakland

 

       GreenSoul Holistic Center -

  At this center cancer clients and those that are concerned about their health will have access to free or low cost services such as acupressure, healthy live foods, healthy workshops, massage, acupuncture, relaxation techniques, lymph drainage, ear candling, detoxification programs. Trainings will be held teaching African healing modalities, Egyptian, Chinese, Aztec, and ancient techniques along with the current medical field of doctors and holistic practioners that will service the community.

    

      Green Jobs Program - One of the community leaders will be Fari teaching youth elders about our green jobs program. Creating green jobs.

 

      Natural Building - Community will learn how to build adobe, strawbale and much more. While creating community spaces and homes on the ecovillage.

GreenSoul Womens Project - Directed by Adibisi Akriminsi Social Worker of Oakland - Helping young teenage girls and women succed in getting good jobs and building up self esteem.

     Affordable Green Homes - Green homes will be built in the community creating healthy living quarters , jobs and afforadable homes.

 

    Botany and organic gardening program - This will be a class teaching the community the identity of herbs and veggies and using them in healthy live food dishes, creating natural products designed by the community.

 

  GreenSoul Store - Will be our eco-store where the natural products that were created our sold. Such as natural soap, natural laundry detergent, organic foods and more.

 

  GreenSoul Healing Workshops - Topics will cover community needs from cancer, organic gardening, relationhips, Abuse, eco-education, rainforest education, botany, solar energy, Live food classes, healing within, relaxation techniques, natural product making, &  green jobs.

 

  GreenSoul Eco-Mart will allow community two days out the week to sale there local crafts and organic food to create community sustainability.

 

 


We can accomplish this if 1 million people donate $10 and more we have 60 days to do it. WE CAN DO IT. Just tell 10 of your friends. Thank you for your support. With much passion.

(The Video above is taken from Ecovilalge IThaca)

 

Love Azalea GreenSoul to all of your GreenSouls

story:
Our Story

We are San Jose, CA's urban Park Rangers, and due to the severe budget crisis, we are an endangered species.  The current 2011/12 budget proposes the elimination of the entire program.  This threatens the legacy of San Jose's precious open space and the quality of life for its residents. 

The Impact

The Park Peace Officer's Association of San Jose (PPOASJ) supports the San Jose Park Rangers and seeks to educate the public and elected officials about the importance of Park Rangers in our urban spaces. The PPOASJ has also faced fiscal crisis which has impaired its ability to provide support for our Rangers.  With our finances stretched, we are unable to effectively reach out to the community and educate our residents about the impact the latest City budget has on our City Parks.

What We Need

Our goal is to raise $5,000 in order to engage in a direct mailing campaign and purchase ad space in local papers.  Any unused money will be used towards environmental education for youth in our parks. 

Please note that all contributions go directly to the PPOASJ, a non-profit organization, and not to individuals or to the City of San Jose.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you simply can't spare any money, we understand.  But your voice is just as powerful as your checkbook.  Email or call your local San Jose representative to tell them that you value Park Rangers in your parks.  Please visit www.sanjoseparkranger.org to find out other ways that you can help.
story_txt:
Our Story
We are San Jose, CA's urban Park Rangers, and due to the severe budget crisis, we are an endangered species.  The current 2011/12 budget proposes the elimination of the entire program.  This threatens the legacy of San Jose's precious open space and the quality of life for its residents.  

The ImpactThe Park Peace Officer's Association of San Jose (PPOASJ) supports the San Jose Park Rangers and seeks to educate the public and elected officials about the importance of Park Rangers in our urban spaces. Our goal is to raise $5,000 in order to engage in a direct mailing campaign and purchase ad space in local papers.  Any unused money will be used towards environmental education for youth in our parks.  Please note that all contributions go directly to the PPOASJ, a non-profit organization, and not to individuals or to the City of San Jose.

Other Ways You Can Help
If you simply can't spare any money, we understand.  But your voice is just as powerful as your checkbook.  Email or call your local San Jose representative to tell them that you value Park Rangers in your parks.  Please visit www.sanjoseparkranger.org to find out other ways that you can help.
